The following is a list of [[endorheic basin]]s—watersheds which do not drain to the sea. ==Africa== * [[Chott Melrhir]] (Algeria) * [[Chott Ech Chergui]] (Algeria) * [[Chott el Hodna]] (Algeria) * [[Tidikelt Depression]] (Algeria) ** [[Sebkha Azzel Matti]] ** [[Sebhka Mekerrhane]] * [[Tunisian salt lakes]] (Tunisia) ** [[Chott el Djerid]] ** [[Chott el Gharsa]] * [[Qattara Depression]] (Egypt) * [[Siwa Depression]] (Egypt) * [[Lake Chad Basin]] ([[Cameroon]], Chad, Niger, [[Nigeria]]) * [[Western Equatorial Crater Lakes]] (Cameroon) ** [[Lake Barombi Koto]] ** [[Lake Barombi Mbo]] ** [[Lake Bermin]] ** Lake Benakouma ** [[Lake Dissoni|Lake Dissoni/Soden]] ** [[Lake Mboandong]] * [[Makgadikgadi Pans]] ([[Botswana]]) * [[Northern Eastern Rift]] ([[Djibouti]], [[Eritrea]], [[Ethiopia]]) ** [[Afar Depression]] (Djibouti, Eritrea, Ethiopia) ** [[Rift Valley Lakes#Ethiopian Rift Valley lakes|Ethiopian Rift Valley lakes]] (Ethiopia) * [[Lake Turkana]] Basin ([[Ethiopia]], [[Kenya]]) * [[Southern Eastern Rift]] (Kenya, Tanzania) ** [[Lake Logipi]] (Kenya) ** [[Lake Baringo]] (Kenya) ** [[Lake Bogoria]] (Kenya) ** [[Lake Nakuru]] (Kenya) ** [[Lake Elmenteita]] (Kenya) ** [[Lake Naivasha]] (Kenya) ** [[Lake Magadi]] (Kenya) ** [[Lake Natron]] (Tanzania) ** [[Lake Eyasi]] (Tanzania) * [[Lake Rukwa]] (Tanzania) * [[Lake Chilwa]] ([[Malawi]]) * [[Lake Chiuta]] (Malawi, Mozambique) * [[Etosha|Etosha Basin]] ([[Angola]], [[Namibia]]) * [[Okavango Basin]] (Angola, [[Botswana]], Namibia, Zimbabwe) ==Antarctica== * [[Lake Vanda]] * [[Lake Vida]] ==Australia== [[File:NEO lake eyre big.jpg|thumb|right|A false-colour satellite photo of [[Australia]]'s [[Lake Eyre]]
Image credit: ''NASA's Earth Observatory'']] * [[Lake Eyre Basin]] ([[Queensland]], [[New South Wales]], [[Northern Territory]], [[South Australia]]), which drains into the highly variable [[Lake Eyre]] and includes [[Lake Frome]]. * [[Lake Torrens]] (South Australia) * [[Lake Corangamite]] (western [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]]) * [[Lake George, New South Wales|Lake George]] (New South Wales), formerly connected to the [[Murray-Darling Basin]]. * [[Bulloo-Bancannia drainage basin]] (New South Wales) ==Eurasia== * [[Caspian Sea]] Basin ([[Armenia]], [[Azerbaijan]], [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]]) [[Iran]], [[Kazakhstan]], [[Russia]], [[Turkey]], [[Turkmenistan]]) including the [[Volga River]]. * [[Aral Sea]] Basin ([[Afghanistan]], [[Kyrgyzstan]], Kazakhstan, [[Tajikistan]], Turkmenistan, [[Uzbekistan]]) including the [[Syr Darya]] and [[Amu Darya]] rivers. [[File:Ocean drainage.png|550px|thumb|right|Major endorheic basins of the world. Basins are shown in dark gray; major endorheic lakes are shown in black.]] * [[Lake Balkhash]] Basin (China, Kazakhstan) * [[Emin Valley]] (China, Kazakhstan) ** [[Lake Alakol]] * [[Issyk-Kul]], [[Son-Kul]] and [[Chatyr-Kul]] lakes (Kyrgyzstan) * [[Dzungarian Basin]] (China) ** [[Ulungur Lake]] ** [[Ebinur Lake]] ** [[Manas Lake]] ** [[Ailik Lake]] * [[Uvs Nuur basin]] ([[Mongolia]], [[Russia]]) * [[Great Lakes Depression]] ([[Mongolia]], [[Russia]]) ** [[Khyargas Nuur|Khyargas-Nurr Lake]] ** [[Khar-Us Lake]] **[[Khar Lake (Khovd)|Khar Lake]] * [[Tarim Basin]] (China) ** [[Lop Nur]] * [[Gobi Desert]] (China, Mongolia) * [[Hulun Lake]] (China, Mongolia), sometimes overflows into the [[Argun River (Asia)|Argun River]], a tributary of the [[Amur River|Amur]] * [[Tibetan (Afghanistan, Iran, [[Pakistan]]) * [[Hamun-e Mashkid]] (Iran, Pakistan) * [[Hari River, Afghanistan]] (Tedzhen River) (Afghanistan, Iran, Turkmenistan) * [[Murghab River (Afghanistan)|Murgab River]] (Afghanistan, Turkmenistan) * [[Iranian Plateau]] (Iran) **[[Bejestan]] **[[Dasht-e Kavir]] **[[Dasht-e Lut]] **[[Zayande River]] **[[Hamun-e Jaz Murian]] **[[Kor River]] (Kor Rud) **[[Lake Maharlu]] {{coord|29.481|52.805|type:waterbody|name=Lake Maharlu}} **[[Namak Lake]] **[[Sirjan]] **[[Yazd]] * [[Lake Urmia]] (Iran) * [[Lake Van]] (Turkey) * [[Central Anatolian lake basins]] (Turkey) ** [[Lake Tuz]] ** [[Lake Beyşehir]] ** [[Lake Eğirdir]] ** [[Lake Burdur]] ** [[Lake Acıgöl]] * [[Syrian Desert]] Basins ([[Syria]], [[Jordan]], [[Iraq]], [[Saudi Arabia]]) ** [[Sabkhat al Muh]] (Syria) ** [[Buhayrat al 'Utaybah]] (Syria) * [[Arabian Peninsula]] ([[Saudi Arabia]], [[Iraq]], [[Jordan]], [[United Arab Emirates]], [[Oman]], [[Yemen]]) ** [[Wadi al-Rummah]] ** [[Wadi Dawasir]] ** [[Rub' al Khali]] ** [[Arabian Desert]] * pluvial [[Sea of Galilee]] and [[Dead Sea]] Basins ([[Israel]], Jordan, [[Lebanon]], [[Palestinian Territories]], Syria) * ([[India]]) ** [[Sambhar Lake]] ([[India]]) ** [[Tso Kar]] ([[India]]) ** [[Tso Moriri]] ([[India]]) ** [[Pangong Tso]] ([[India]]) * [[Neusiedlersee]] ([[Austria]]) * [[Lake Trasimeno]] ([[Italy]]) * [[Laguna de Gallocanta]] ([[Spain]]) * [[Estany de Banyoles]] (Spain) * The [[Lasithi Plateau]] in [[Crete]], [[Greece]] * [[Lake Chany]], Russia ==North America== * Endorheic basins in the [[Great Plains]] ** [[Quill Lakes]], Lenore Lake, and Basin Lake ([[Saskatchewan]]) ** [[Coteau du Missouri]]-[[Old Wives Lake]] (Saskatchewan) ** [[Great Sand Hills]]-Crane Lake and Bigstick Lake (Saskatchewan) ** [[Pakowki Lake]] ([[Alberta]]) ** [[Manitou Lake (Saskatchewan)|Manito]], Tramping, Buffalo, and Sullivan lakes (Alberta, Saskatchewan) ** [[Little Manitou Lake (Saskatchewan)|Little Manitou Lake]] (Saskatchewan) ** [[Devils Lake (North Dakota)]] ** [[Coteau des Prairies]] (mostly South Dakota) ** The [[Sandhills (Nebraska)]] ** [[White Woman Basin]] (Kansas) * [[Devil's Lake (Wisconsin)]] * [[Great Divide Basin]] ([[Wyoming]]) * [[San Luis Closed Basin]] ([[Colorado]]) * [[Crater Lake]] ([[Oregon]]) * [[Great Basin]] {{Cite book | last = Houghton | first = Samuel G. | title = A trace of desert waters: the Great Basin story | publisher = University of Nevada Press | year = 1994 | location = Reno}} in [[California]], [[Idaho]], [[Nevada]], Oregon, [[Utah]] and [[Wyoming]]) {{main|List of Great Basin watersheds}} ** [[Oregon Lakes]] (California, Oregon) *** [[Harney Basin]] ([[Harney Lake|Harney]] and [[Malheur Lake|Malheur]] lakes) (Oregon) *** [[Alvord Lake (Oregon)]] *** [[Goose Lake (Oregon-California)|Goose Lake]] (California, Oregon) *** [[Summer Lake (Oregon)|Summer]] and [[Silver Lake (Oregon)|Silver]] lakes (Oregon) ** [[Lahontan Valley|North Lahontan Basin]] (California, Nevada, Oregon), a system of endorheic sub-basins connected with [[Pluvial lake|pluvial]] [[Lake Lahontan]] *** [[Pyramid Lake (Nevada)|Pyramid Lake]] (a remnant of Lake Lahontan) fed by [[Truckee River]]-[[Lake Tahoe]] (California, Nevada) **** [[Honey Lake]]-[[Eagle Lake (Lassen County)|Eagle Lake]] (California) *** [[Walker Lake (Nevada)|Walker Lake]] (another remnant of Lake Lahontan) fed by [[Walker River]] (California, Nevada) *** [[Black Rock Desert]] (Nevada) *** [[Carson Sink]] – [[Carson River]] (Nevada) *** [[Humboldt Sink]] – [[Humboldt River]] (Nevada) *** [[Quinn River]] (Nevada) ** Bonneville Basin (Idaho, Nevada, Utah, Wyoming), a system of endorheic basins connected to [[Pluvial lake|pluvial]] [[Lake Bonneville]] *** [[Great Salt Lake]] (remnant of Lake Bonneville) in Utah *** [[Sevier Lake]] (Utah) *** [[Utah Lake]] – [[Jordan River (Utah)|Jordan River]] ** [[Water in California#Surface water|South Lahontan Basin]] (California, Nevada), draining into pluvial [[Lake Manly]] in [[Death Valley]] *** [[Amargosa River]]-[[Badwater Basin]] (California, Nevada) *** [[Mono Basin]]/[[Mono Lake|Lake]], [[Owens River]]/[[Owens Lake|Lake]], [[China Lake]], [[Searles Valley]]/[[Searles Lake|Lake]], [[Panamint Valley]] (California, Nevada) **** [[Rogers Dry Lake|Rogers]] and [[Rosamond Lake]]s (California) *** pluvial [[Lake Mojave]] ([[Silver Lake (Mojave)|Silver Lake]] and [[Soda Lake (San Bernardino County)|Soda Lake]], California) **** [[Mojave River]] (California) **** [[Danby Lake]], Cadiz Lake, [[Bristol Lake]] ** Central Nevada basins separate from the Bonneville and Lahontan systems *** [[Groom Dry Lake]] (Nevada) ** Disjunct [[Colorado River]] tributaries *** pluvial [[Lake Cahuilla]] and [[Salton Sea]] (California, [[Baja California]]) *** [[Eldorado Valley]]-[[Pahrump Valley]] (California, Nevada) * [[Willcox Playa]] ([[Arizona]]) * [[Zuni Salt Lake]] ([[New Mexico]]) * [[Tularosa Basin]] (New Mexico, [[Texas]]) *[[Guzmán Basin]] (Chihuahua, [[Mexico]], southwestern New Mexico) *[[Bolsón de Mapimí]] (Chihuahua, Coahuila, Durango, and Zacatecas, Mexico) *[[Llanos el Salado]] (Coahuila, Nuevo León, San Luis Potosí, Tamaulipas, and Zacatecas, Mexico) *[[Valley of Mexico]] (Federal District, Hidalgo, Mexico, and Tlaxcala, Mexico) *[[Oriental Basin]] (Puebla, Tlaxcala, and Veracruz, Mexico) *[[Lake Pátzcuaro]] (Michoacan, Mexico) *[[Lake Cuitzeo]] (Michoacan, Mexico) *[[Lago de Atitlán]] ([[Guatemala]]) *[[Lake O'Hara]]([[Yoho National Park]]) ([[BC, Canada]]) *[[Frame Lake]], [[Yellowknife]], [[Northwest Territories]], Canada ==South America== *[[Altiplano]] ([[Argentina]], [[Bolivia]], [[Chile]], [[Peru]]) includes [[Lake Titicaca]], [[Lake Poopo]], and the [[Salar de Uyuni]]. *[[Lake Valencia (Venezuela)|Lake Valencia]] (Venezuela) *[[Desagues de los Colorados]] (northeastern Argentina) *[[Dulce River (Argentina)]]-[[Laguna de Mar Chiquita]] (north-central Argentina) *[[Northwest Pampas Basins]] ([[Dry Pampas]] of central Argentina) *[[Southwest Pampas Basins]] ([[Dry Pampas]] of central Argentina) *[[Meseta Somuncura]] ([[Patagonia]] region of southern Argentina) ==Islands== * [[Cul-de-Sac Depression]] and [[Lago Enriquillo]], on [[Hispaniola]] Island. * [[Buada Lagoon]], [[Nauru]] * [[Kauhakō Crater]], [[Molokai|Molokai, Hawaii]] * [[Lake Waiau]], [[Hawaii]] (at low levels) ==Ancient== Some of the Earth's ancient endorheic systems include: * The [[Black Sea]], until its merger with the Mediterranean * The [[Mediterranean Sea]] and all its tributary basins, during its [[Messinian salinity crisis|Messinian desiccation]] (5 [[Mya (unit)|mya]] approximately) as it became disconnected from the Atlantic Ocean. * [[Ebro]] and [[Duero]] basins, draining most of northern [[Spain]] during the [[Neogene]] and perhaps [[Pliocene]]. * [[Lake Tanganyika]] in Africa. Currently at an overflow level and therefore draining into the sea via the [[Lukuga River]], but the lake level has been lower in the past, possibly as recently as 1800. * [[Tularosa Basin]] and Lake Cabeza de Vaca in North America. Basin formerly much larger than at present, including the ancestral [[Rio Grande]] north of Texas, feeding a large lake area. ==References== *Africa ** Thieme, Michelle L. (2005). ''Freshwater Ecoregions of Africa and Madagascar: A Conservation Assessment''. Island Press, Washington DC. pages 24–25. ** "Cameroon Crater Lakes", World Wildlife Fund [https://web.archive.org/web/20061007180042/http://worldwildlife.org/wildworld/profiles/g200/g186.html] * Australia * Eurasia ** "Freshwater Fishes of Iran: Drainage Basins" [http://www.briancoad.com/Introduction/Drainage%20Basins.htm] * North America ** "Watersheds" map in the ''North American Atlas'' [https://archive.is/20070612063541/http://www.cec.org/naatlas/watersheds.cfm] ** Ricketts, Taylor H., Eric Dinerstein, David M. Olson, Colby J. Loucks, et al. (1999). ''Terrestrial Ecoregions of North America: a Conservation Assessment''. Island Press, Washington DC. pages 26–29. * South America ** Olson, D., Dinerstein, E., Canevari, P., Davidson, I., Castro, G., Morisset, V., Abell, R., and Toledo, E.; eds. (1998). ''Freshwater Biodiversity of Latin America and the Caribbean: A Conservation Assessment.'' Biodiversity Support Program, Washington DC., pages xiv–xv, 24–26. page.title: List of minimum annual leave by country

revision.comment: /* Countries */ public holidays count corrected for Armenia
revision.text:
[[File:Map of Vacation Days Around the World.png|thumb|upright=2.1|Minimum mandatory paid vacation days, normalised for a five-day workweek:
{{legend|#FFFFFF|No data}} {{legend|#e0e0e0|No mandatory vacation}} {{legend|#C7E9B4|1–5 days}} {{legend|#7FCDBB|6–10 days}} {{legend|#41B6C4|11–15 days}} {{legend|#0570b0|16–20 days}} {{legend|#225EA8|21–22 days}} {{legend|#023858|23–28 days}}
]] In the majority of nations, including all industrialised nations except the United States, advances in [[Labour law|employee relations]] have seen the introduction of statutory agreements for minimum [[Annual leave|employee leave from work]]—that is the amount of entitlement to paid vacation and public holidays. Several companies will offer contractually more time, depending on the sector. Companies and the law may also differ as to whether [[Lists of holidays|public holidays]] are counted as part of the minimum leave. Disparities in national minimums are still subject of debate regarding [[work-life balance]] and perceived differences between nations. These numbers usually refer to full-time employment, part-time workers may get a reduced number of days. In most countries, public holidays are paid and usually not considered part of the annual leave. Also, in most countries there are additional paid leave benefits such as [[parental leave]] and [[sick leave]] that are not listed here. == Methodology == For the purpose of comparison, the paid vacation column has been normalised to a five-day workweek. For instance, a calendar day is divided by seven and multiplied by five, while a six-day workweek day is divided by six and multiplied by five. The paid vacation column gives the minimum mandatory vacation days for an employee who has one year of service with the same employer. In some countries, the public holidays are strictly bound to the calendar dates, so if they happen on Saturday or Sunday, they are "lost" for the particular year. As a result, the average number of paid extra free days can be lower than the table specifies. For example, in the Czech Republic, where the official number of paid public holidays is 13, the average number of public holidays during working days in the years 2000–2016 was only 8.9 days. In other countries, the public holidays which happen on Saturday or Sunday are moved to the nearest Monday or Friday such as in the United Kingdom or the United States. ==Countries== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! width=120 | Country and flag ! class="unsortable" | Minimum annual leave ! style="width:150px;" data-sort- type="number"| Paid vacation days
(five-day workweek){{cite news|last1=Ghosheh|first1=Naj|title=Working conditions laws report 2012: A global review|url=http://www.ilo.org/wcmsp5/groups/public/---ed_protect/---protrav/---travail/documents/publication/wcms_235155.pdf|accessdate=11 September 2014|agency=International Labour Organization|date=2013}}{{cite web|url=http://www.doingbusiness.org/data/edata/ExploreTopics/labor-market-regulation|title=Employing Workers|last=|first=|date=|website=Doing Business: Measuring Business Regulations|publisher=World Bank Group|accessdate=1 October 2014}}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} ! style="width:120px;" data-sort- type="number"| Paid public holidays{{cite web|title = Worldwide National Public Holidays for 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020|url = http://www.qppstudio.net/publicholidays.htm|website = www.qppstudio.net|access-date = 2016-02-13|last = qppstudio.net}}{{cite web|title = Employment law by country|url = http://www.fedee.com/kb/countries|website = www.fedee.com|access-date = 2016-02-14|archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20160222064808/http://www.fedee.com/kb/countries|archive-date = 2016-02-22|dead-url = yes|df = }} ! style="width:120px;" data-sort- type="number"| Total paid leave (five-day workweek) |- |{{flag|Afghanistan}} |Employees are entitled to 20 days recreational leave and [[Public holidays in Afghanistan|15 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|title=Travail Legal Database: Working Time in the Asian Region|url=http://www.ilo.org/dyn/travail/travmain.sectionReport1?p_lang=en&p_structure=2&p_sc_id=1368&p_sc_id=1694&p_sc_id=1390&p_sc_id=1717&p_countries=REG3|website=Travail: Conditions of Work and Employment Programme|publisher=International Labour Organization|accessdate=16 September 2014}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|35 |- |{{flag|Albania}} |Employees are entitled to 20 days of annual leave and [[Public holidays in Albania|12 paid public holidays]].{{Cite book|title = European Social Charter (revised): Albania, Armenia, Belgium, Bilgaria, Cyprus, Estonia, Finland, France|url = https://books.google.com/books?id=e19_13snDgUC|publisher = Council of Europe|date = 2007-01-01|isbn = 9789287163387|language = en|first = Comité européen des Droits|last = sociaux|page = 19}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|32 |- |{{flag|Algeria}} |The paid annual leave is calculated on the basis of 2 and 1/2 days per month of work. The total duration of the leave cannot, however, exceed 30 calendar days per year.{{cite web|title=Travail Legal Database: Working Time in the Africa Region|url=http://www.ilo.org/dyn/travail/travmain.sectionReport1?p_lang=en&p_structure=2&p_sc_id=1368&p_sc_id=1694&p_sc_id=1390&p_sc_id=1717&p_countries=REG1|website=Travail: Conditions of Work and Employment Programme|publisher=International Labour Organization|accessdate=1 October 2014}} Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Algeria|11 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|30 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|41 |- |{{flag|Andorra}} |Workers are entitled to 31 calendar days of paid leave after one year of employment. Before that, entitlement to leave is calculated at a rate of 2.5 days for every month worked. One period of leave must last two weeks or more to allow an uninterrupted rest period.{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=32vwQRE70jMC|title=European Social Charter (revised): European Committee of Social Rights, Conclusions (2010)|first=Council of Europe: European Committee of Social|last=Rights|date=6 October 2011|publisher=Council of Europe|via=Google Books}} Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Andorra|14 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bopa.ad/bopa/027073/Pagines/GH20151023_09_22_50.aspx|title=Decret del 21-10-2015 pel qual s’aprova el calendari laboral corresponent a l’any 2016.|publisher=}} | style="text-align:center;"|31 | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|45 |- |{{flag|Angola}} |The period of annual leave for workers is of 22 days per year, not including weekends, complementary weekly rest days and holidays in this calculation. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Angola|11 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|title = Lei de trbalho Angolana. O que não deve esquecer|url = http://www.meusalario.org/angola/main/lei-geral-do-trabalho/lei-de-trbalho-angolana.-o-que-nao-deve-esquecer|website = www.meusalario.org|access-date = 2016-02-15}} | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|33 |- |{{flag|Antigua and Barbuda}} |The length of the annual leave for an employee who has successfully passed his probationary period is at least one day per month of employment; 12 days per year of work performed. Every employees is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Antigua and Barbuda|11 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|title=Travail Legal Database: Working Time in the Americas Region|url=http://www.ilo.org/dyn/travail/travmain.sectionReport1?p_lang=en&p_structure=2&p_sc_id=1368&p_sc_id=1694&p_sc_id=1390&p_sc_id=1717&p_countries=REG5&p_start=1&p_increment=10|website=Travail: Conditions of Work and Employment Programme|publisher=International Labour Organization|accessdate=16 September 2014}} | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|23 |- |{{flag|Argentina}} | 14 calendar days (from 0 to 5 years seniority), 21 calendar days (from 5 to 10), 28 calendar days (from 10 to 20) and 35 calendar days (from 20). Every employees is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Argentina|11 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20161005130519/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/latinamerica/argentina-english-old.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|21 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|31 |- |{{flag|Armenia}} |Generally, the duration of annual leave is 20 working days. Extended annual leave up to 25 working days is granted to certain categories of employees whose work involves great nervous, emotional and intellectual strain and professional risk.{{cite web|title=Travail Legal Database: Working Time in the European Region|url=http://www.ilo.org/dyn/travail/travmain.sectionReport1?p_lang=en&p_structure=2&p_sc_id=1368&p_sc_id=1694&p_sc_id=1390&p_sc_id=1717&p_countries=REG4&p_start=1&p_increment=10|website=Travail: Conditions of Work and Employment Programme|publisher=International Labour Organization|accessdate=16 September 2014}} Every employees is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Armenia|12 paid public holidays]].{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=32vwQRE70jMC|title=European Social Charter (revised): European Committee of Social Rights, Conclusions (2010)|last=Rights|first=Council of Europe: European Committee of Social|date=2011-10-06|publisher=Council of Europe|isbn=9789287171474|page=84|language=en}}{{cite web|url=https://rm.coe.int/CoERMPublicCommonSearchServices/DisplayDCTMContent?documentId=090000168048abfb |title=Documents |website=rm.coe.int |format=PDF}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|16{{Cite web|url=https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vR5choBCsF0sNu71IhElOvFSlrvgEnt6fXPeECKA0RPPtPD_TOXMeR2VPSkgcUFqE0lNK0M9paYpN8G/pubhtml|title=Non-working holidays in Armenia|website=docs.google.com|access-date=2018-12-03}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.arlis.am/DocumentView.aspx?docid=125613|title=DocumentView|website=www.arlis.am|access-date=2018-12-03}} | style="text-align:center;"|36 |- |{{flag|Australia}} |For each year of service with his or her employer, an employee is entitled to a minimum of 4 weeks of paid annual leave, unless the employee is a shiftworker, in which case he or she is entitled to a minimum of 5 weeks of paid annual leave. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Australia|10 to 13 paid public holidays]] depending on the state and territory. [[Long service leave]], which varies by jurisdiction, is also available to long standing employees.{{cite web|title=Leave|url=http://www.fairwork.gov.au/Leave|website=Fair Work Obudsman|publisher=Australian Government|accessdate=16 October 2014}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|30 |- |{{flag|Austria}} |If the employee has less than 25 years of service, he is entitled to 25 days of annual leave. If the employee has 25 years or more, he is entitled to 30 days of annual leave. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Austria|13 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url = http://www.arbeiterkammer.at/beratung/arbeitundrecht/Urlaub/So_viel_Urlaub_bekommen_Sie.html|title = Ihr Anspruch auf Urlaub|date = |accessdate = |website = Arbeiterkammer|publisher = |last = |first = }}[https://web.archive.org/web/20161005125553/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/austria-english.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|25 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|38 |- |{{flag|Azerbaijan}} | Employees are entitled to a minimum of 21 basic calendar days of annual leave. Skilled employees, experts and senior employees are entitled to 30 basic calendar days of annual leave. Additional 2 days accrue on top of basic vacation every 5 years.{{cite web|url = http://www.ilo.org/dyn/natlex/docs/WEBTEXT/46039/65055/E94AZE02.htm|title = Azerbaijan: Law on Leaves (Unofficial translation)|date = |accessdate = 16 October 2014|website = Natlex|publisher = International Labour Organization|last = |first = }} Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Azerbaijan|19 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20161224094120/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/russia/azerbaijan-english] | style="text-align:center;"|21 | style="text-align:center;"|19 | style="text-align:center;"|40 |- |{{flag|The Bahamas}} |14 days after 1 year employment, 21 days after 7 years of employment. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in the Bahamas|10 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bahamas.gov.bs/wps/wcm/connect/65b3d851-5769-4914-9f2e-235171ac8033/Employment+(Amendment),+2012+DRAFT.pdf?MOD=AJPERES |title=Employment amendment |date=2012 |website=www.bahamas.gov.bs}}{{cite web|url=http://laws.bahamas.gov.bs/cms/images/LEGISLATION/PRINCIPAL/1938/1938-0015/PublicHolidaysAct_1.pdf |title=Legislation |date=1938 |website=laws.bahamas.gov.bs |format=PDF}} | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|20 |- |{{flag|Bahrain}} |An employee who has been in the service of an employer for at least one year is entitled to a paid annual leave not less than thirty days, with an average of two and a half days for each month.{{cite web|url=http://www.ilo.org/dyn/natlex/docs/MONOGRAPH/91026/105342/F265276925/BHR91026%20Eng.pdf |title=Monograph |website=http://www.ilo.org |format=PDF}} Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Bahrain|14 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20161224100013/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/gulf-middle-east/bahrain-english] | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|36 |- |{{flag|Bangladesh}} |All workers except tea plantation workers are entitled to 10 days of paid casual leave in each calendar year. An adult worker is entitled to: (a) for shop, commercial or industrial establishment, factory, or road transport service industry workers – one day's paid annual leave per 18 days of work; (b) for tea plantation workers – one day's paid annual leave per 22 days of work; and (c) for newspaper workers – one day's paid annual leave per 11 days of work. Every worker is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Bangladesh|11 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20161005124957/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/asia/bangladesh-english.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|21 |- |{{flag|Barbados}} |An employee who completes a year of employment with an employer is entitled to – (a) an annual holiday of not less than 3 weeks where he has been in the employment of that employer for less than 5 years; and (b) an annual holiday of not less than 4 weeks where he has been in the service of that employer for 5 years or more. | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Belarus}} |The length of basic annual leave is 24 calendar days. Plus 3 calendar days might be granted in addition for long time employment. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Belarus|9 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20161224100106/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/russia/belrus-english] | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|29 |- |{{flag|Belgium}} |Before 2012, a worker after one year of full employment is entitled to: 24 working days if they work 6 days per week; and 20 working days if they work 5 days per week. This was challenged by the EU {{Cite web|url=http://europa.eu/rapid/press-release_IP-11-1417_en.htm|title=European Commission - PRESS RELEASES - Press release - Working time: Commission requests Belgium to end compulsory postponement of workers' annual leave|website=europa.eu|language=en|access-date=2018-12-01}}. From June 2012, workers are allowed to take holidays in their first year of employment{{Cite web|url=https://www.groups.be/1_59300.htm|title=New rules for paid holidays|last=S|first=Group|website=www.groups.be|language=en|access-date=2018-12-01}}. Workers are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Belgium|10 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|title=Developments in collectively agreed working time 2013|website=EIROnline, European industrial relations observatory on-line|publisher=Eurofund|accessdate=26 September 2014|url = http://www.eurofound.europa.eu/eiro/studies/TN1405020S/index.htm}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|30 |- |{{flag|Belize}} |Every employee is entitled to two weeks paid leave after a year of employment. If employment is terminated after three months but before a year, the employee must be paid average vacation pay. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Belize|13 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20140819112930/http://labour.gov.bz/index.php/en/2013-02-12-02-42-04#ancla5 Labour Advice] | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|27 |- |{{flag|Benin}} |Unless there are more favorable provisions in collective agreements or employment contracts, the worker acquires the right to leave, to be paid by the employer, at the rate of 2 working days per month of effective service. A working days is every day other than the day of weekly rest period and holidays. Every worker is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Benin|13 paid public holidays]].{{cite web |url=http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/benin-english%20delete.pdf |title=Archived copy |access-date=2016-10-04 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161005194501/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/benin-english%20delete.pdf |archive-date=2016-10-05 |dead-url=yes |df= }} | style="text-align:center;"|24 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|37 |- |{{flag|Bhutan}} | | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Bolivia}} |There are different scales of annual leave depending on the seniority of the worker. To this respect; workers having performed from 1 to 5 years of service are entitled to enjoy 15 working days, from 5 to 10 years, 20 working days, and from 10 years onwards, 30 working days. Every worker is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Bolivia|11 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|15/20/30 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|26/31/41 |- |{{flag|Bosnia and Herzegovina}} |Bosnia and Herzegovina consists of 2 entities (Republic of Srpska and Federation of Bosina and Herzegovina) and one district (Brčko District). These 3 parts all have their own work laws. Both Republic of Srpska and Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina have minimum of 20 working days while number of additional days varies. In District Brčko workers have 18 days. In Republic of Srpska workers have additional 1 day for every 5 years of work at same employee and additional 2 days for religious holidays. In Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina workers have 2 paid days for religious holidays and, optionally, 2 unpaid days for religious holidays. Number of public holidays also varies in all 3 autonomous parts. In Republic of Srpska around 11, in Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina around 10 and in Brčko District around 9. Number of public holidays varies based on predominant religious group in entity. Note that Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina consists of 10 cantons of which any can have their own laws that can affect number of public holidays. | style="text-align:center;"|20-30 | style="text-align:center;"|9-11 | style="text-align:center;"|29-41 |- |{{flag|Botswana}} |Every employer is required to grant to every employee employed by him leave with basic pay at the rate of not less than 1.25 days per month. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Botswana|14 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|29 |- |{{flag|Brazil}} |The length of annual leave depends on the number of days of absence from work: 30 calendar days (22 working days, considering a 5-day workweek) when the worker was absent no more than 5 days; 24 calendar days (18 working days) when the worker was absent between 6 and 14 days; 18 calendar days (14 working days) when the worker was absent between 15 and 23 days; 12 calendar days (10 working days) when the worker was absent between 24 and 32 days. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Brazil|7 national paid public holidays, 1 state paid holiday, and up to 4 religious municipal paid holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20161224095628/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/latinamerica/brazil-english.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|10/14/18/22 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|22/26/30/34 |- |{{flag|Brunei Darussalam}} |[11] | style="text-align:center;"|7 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|18 |- |{{flag|Bulgaria}} |An employee has the right to paid annual leave in the duration of at least four weeks for each calendar year. If a public holiday falls on Saturday or Sunday, the following Monday is a holiday.{{cite web|url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public_holidays_in_Bulgaria|title=Public Holidays in Bulgaria}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|32 |- |{{flag|Burkina Faso}} |The employee has a right to a paid leave chargeable to the employer, at the rate of two and a half calendar days per month of effective service. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Burkina Faso|15 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20161224095006/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/burkina-faso-english] | style="text-align:center;"|30 | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|45 |- |{{flag|Burundi}} |Workers are entitled to 1 and 2/3 working days per month of completed of service. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Burundi|13 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160222091553/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/Decentworkcheck-Burundi-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|17 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|30 |- |{{flag|Cape Verde}} |Every worker in an employment contract for an indeterminate period is entitled to twenty-two days of annual leave. There are no legal provisions for pay on [[Public holidays in Cape Verde|public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160302105120/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/Decentworkcheck-Cape%20Verde-20151203-English.pdf.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"|22 |- |{{flag|Cambodia}} |All workers are entitled to paid annual leave at the rate of 1.5 work days per month of continuous service. However, the length of paid leave entitlement shall be increased according to seniority, at the rate of one day per 3 years of service. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Cambodia|27 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160222080405/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/asia/Decentworkcheck-Cambodia-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|18 | style="text-align:center;"|27 | style="text-align:center;"|45 |- |{{flag|Cameroon}} |Workers acquire the right to annual leave at the rate of one and a half days per month of effective service, paid by the employer. | style="text-align:center;"|18 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Canada}} |In Canada, vacation time is set by the provinces and territories for all employees except federal employees. Employees are entitled to start out with two weeks of paid vacation in all provinces except [[Saskatchewan]] where employees are entitled to three weeks of paid annual leave.{{cite web|url=http://www.payworks.ca/payroll-legislation/VacationPay.asp|title=Canadian Payroll Legislation : Vacation Pay {{!}} Payworks|website=www.payworks.ca|access-date=2016-03-07}} Ten provinces and territories grant a third week of vacation after working for a set period of time, one grants a fourth week, and two grant no additional extension.{{cite web|url=http://www.canadaone.com/ezine/july07/inoutvacation.html|title=The Ins and Outs of Vacation Time & Vacation Pay|website=CanadaOne}} Federal employees are entitled initially to two weeks vacation, increasing to three weeks after six years of service.{{cite web|url=http://www.workershelp.ca/vacation.asp#FJ|title=Workershelp.ca - Vacations, Vacation Pay and Annual Holidays|website=www.workershelp.ca}} In addition, employees are entitled to [[Public holidays in Canada|6–10 paid public holidays]] depending on the province.{{cite web|url=http://www.publicholidays.ca/|title=Public / Statutory Holidays in Canada (Nationally and Provincially)|website=www.publicholidays.ca|access-date=2016-03-07}} | style="text-align:center;"|10-20 | style="text-align:center;"|6-10 | style="text-align:center;"|16-30 |- |{{flag|Central African Republic}} |Workers are entitled to leave at the rate of 2 working days per month worked. | style="text-align:center;"|24 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Chad}} |Workers are entitled to two days per month of paid leave - to be paid by the employer. One month of effective work is the period equivalent to 4 weeks or 24 days of work. Every worker is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Chad|3 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|24 | style="text-align:center;"|3 | style="text-align:center;"|27 |- |{{flag|Chile}} |The duration of the annual leave is 15 working days. Every worker is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Chile|15 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160222064646/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/latinamerica/Decentworkcheck-Chile-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|30 |- |{{flag|China}} |The duration of the annual leave entitlement is: (a) 5 days for employees who have accumulatively worked for 1–10 years; (b) 10 days for employees who have accumulatively worked for 10–20 years; and (c) 15 days for employees who have accumulatively worked for more than 20 years. Employers who offer more vacation time are legally obligated to grant it.{{cite web|url=http://www.chinalawblog.com/2016/02/china-employee-vacation-law.html|title=China Employee Vacation Law - China Law Blog|date=26 February 2016|publisher=}} Every worker is also entitled to [[Public holidays in China|11 paid public holidays]], which includes two semi-annual one-week holidays known as the [[Golden Week (China)|Golden Weeks]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20161225081639/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/asia/china-english] | style="text-align:center;"|5/10/15 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|16/21/26 |- |{{flag|Colombia}} |Employees are entitled to 15 consecutive working days of paid annual leave. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Colombia|18 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20161225144456/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/latinamerica/colombia-english.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|18 | style="text-align:center;"|33 |- |{{flag|Comoros}} |Workers are entitled to annual leave at the rate of at least 2 and half days per month of work. In order to determine the duration of the leave, it shall be considered as a month of work, the period equivalent to 4 weeks or 24 days of work. | style="text-align:center;"|25 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Democratic Republic of Congo}} |The duration of annual leave has to be of at least one day for every month of effective service, for worker over the age of 18. It shall be of at least one and a half day for workers under the age of 18. It shall be increased of one day per month every 5 years of seniority in the same employer or replaced employer. | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Republic of Congo}} |Workers are entitled, after one year of service, to 26 working days of annual leave paid by the employer. | style="text-align:center;"|26 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Costa Rica}} |Employees are entitled to 2 weeks minimum of annual leave after 50 weeks of work performed with the same employer. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Costa Rica|9 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20161225081452/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/latinamerica/costa-rica-english.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|19 |- |{{flag|Croatia}} |An employee has the right to paid annual leave in the duration of at least four weeks for each calendar year and [[Public holidays in Croatia|13 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20170203081751/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/croatia-english.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|33 |- |{{flag|Cuba}} |Every worker is entitled to enjoy one month of paid annual leave after 11 months of effective work. Workers are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Cuba|9 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|33 |- |{{flag|Cyprus}} |20 working days of leave for workers on a five-day week and 24 working days of leave for workers on a six-day week over a period of one year's employment. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Cyprus|14 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160222071559/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/Decentworkcheck-Cyprus-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|34 |- |{{flag|Czech Republic}} |The basic vacation allowance is a minimum of four weeks per calendar year and there are [[Public holidays in the Czech Republic|13 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=http://www.ilo.org/ifpdial/information-resources/national-labour-law-profiles/WCMS_158893/lang--en/index.htm|title=National Labour Law Profile: The Czech Republic|website=www.ilo.org|language=en|access-date=2016-03-10}}{{cite web|url=https://www.cnb.cz/en/public/media_service/schedules/media_svatky.html|title=ČNB|website=www.cnb.cz|language=en|access-date=2016-03-10}}[https://web.archive.org/web/20161225080853/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/czech-english.pdf ] Many employers give one week extra (so the total is five weeks of paid annual leave) as a bonus. Public holidays which happen on Saturday or Sunday are lost for the particular year – thus the average number of public holidays during working days in the years 2000–2016 was only 8.9 days. Employees of employers who are not part of the private sector or engaged in non-commercial activities are entitled to a vacation allowance of 5 weeks. Teachers and the academic staff of higher education institutions are entitled to a vacation allowance of 8 weeks per calendar year. | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|33 |- |{{flag|Denmark}} |Employees are entitled to 25 days of annual leave per year worked, prorated at 2.08 days per month.{{cite news|last1=Ray|first1=Rebecca|last2=Schmitt|first2=John|title=No‐vacation nation USA – in OECD countries|url=http://www.law.harvard.edu/programs/lwp/papers/No_Holidays.pdf|accessdate=25 September 2014|work=European Economic and Employment Policy Brief|issue=No. 3 -- 2007|ref=Ray}} Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Denmark|11 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=https://publicholidays.dk/|title=Denmark Public Holidays - PublicHolidays.dk|website=PublicHolidays.dk}} | style="text-align:center;"|25 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|36 |- |{{flag|Djibouti}} |Employees are entitled to two and half working days of paid leave per month. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Djibouti|10 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|25 | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|35 |- |{{flag|Dominica}} |Employees are entitled under five years of continuously service two weeks paid annual leave, and for five years and over of continuously service three weeks of paid annual leave. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Dominica|12 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|22 |- |{{flag|Dominican Republic}} |The employer shall provide every employee a paid vacation period of two weeks, according to the following scale: After a period of at least 1 year and up to 5 years, 14 days with full pay; After a continuous period of work of not less than 5 years, 18 days with full pay. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in the Dominican Republic|13 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|23 |- |{{flag|Ecuador}} |Every worker shall be entitled to enjoy 15 consecutive days of paid annual leave, including the non working days. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Ecuador|12 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=http://latinlawyer.com/reference/topics/62/jurisdictions/32/ecuador/|title=Latin Lawyer|last=http://www.lbresearch.com|first=Law Business Research Ltd.,|website=latinlawyer.com|access-date=2016-12-23}}{{Citation|title=La Ley de feriados fue aprobada y regirá para el descanso de Navidad y fin de año|url=http://www.elcomercio.com/actualidad/aprobacion-ley-feriados-ecuador-asambleanacional.html|accessdate=2016-12-23}} | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|23 |- |{{flag|Egypt}} |Employees are entitled to 21 days of paid annual leave, though they must wait six months before taking their first day off. After five consecutive years of employment, an employee may take one month of paid leave to make a religious pilgrimage. An employee's paid leave entitlement increases to 30 days of paid annual leave after 10 years of employment or when the employee reaches the age of 50, whichever one comes first. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Egypt|13 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=https://www.justlanded.com/english/Egypt/Egypt-Guide/Jobs/Working-conditions-in-Egypt|title=Working conditions in Egypt|publisher=}}[https://web.archive.org/web/20161225144729/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/egypt-english.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|28 |- |{{flag|El Salvador}} |The length of annual leave is 15 days. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in El Salvador|11 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20161225081643/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/latinamerica/el-salvador-english.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|26 |- |{{flag|Equatorial Guinea}} |Workers are entitled to one month of paid annual leave, for each year of continuous work. After 10 years of service, annual leave shall be increased one day per year worked. | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Eritrea}} |An employee is entitled to annual leave with pay amounting to: fourteen working days for the first year of service; and fourteen working days plus one working each additional year of service. Annual leave may not exceed 35 working days. | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Estonia}} |It is presumed that an employee's annual holiday is 28 calendar days, unless the employee and the employer have agreed on a longer period, or unless otherwise provided by law. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Estonia|11 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160222100836/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/Decentworkcheck-Estonia-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|31 |- |{{flag|Ethiopia}} |Employees are entitled to no less than 14 working days of annual leave for the first one year of service, and 14 working days plus one working day for every additional year of service. Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Ethiopia|13 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160222102654/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/Decentworkcheck-Ethiopia-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|25 |- |{{flag|European Union}} |[[European Union]] legislation mandates that all 28 member states must by law grant all employees a minimum of 4 weeks of paid vacation - that is 28 days, because "weekly" is defined in article 6 as a "seven-day period".[http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=CELEX:32003L0088:EN:HTML 2003/88/EC] articles 7 and 6 | style="text-align:center;"|28 | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"|28 |- |{{flag|Fiji}} |Workers are entitled to 10 days paid annual leave for each complete year of service. Every employee is also entitled to [[List of festivals in Fiji|12 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|22 |- |{{flag|Finland}} |5 weeks (30 days with Saturdays sometimes, but not Sundays, counted as holidays) is the minimum mandated annual leave by law.{{cite web|url=http://www.tem.fi/en/work/labour_legislation/annual_holiday|title=Ministry of Employment and the Economy - Annual holiday|date=11 February 2010|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140606220629/http://www.tem.fi/en/work/labour_legislation/annual_holiday|archivedate=6 June 2014|df=}} Workers are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Finland|11 paid public holidays]] on average.[https://web.archive.org/web/20160222122613/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/Decentworkcheck-Finland-English.pdf ] After working for the same company for a long period, many employers raise the 30 to 38 days (so-called long holidays). (Many employers in Finland give a holiday bonus (lomaraha) every year; this holiday bonus can be converted to extra holiday - giving another 13 days of holiday (or 18 days for those on 'long' holidays). | style="text-align:center;"|25 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|36 |- |{{flag|France}} |5 weeks (30 days with Saturdays, but not Sundays counted as holidays) plus up to 22 days of RTT (Réduction du Temps de Travail, English: Reduction of Working Time) for the employees that choose to work more than 35 hours per week - the "limit" is 39 per week, further additional hours are compensated in almost all the cases by money and not by additional leave hours. Bonus days off are given to people who take a part of their annual leave outside summer (3 days grant 1 bonus day off, 6 days grant 2 bonus days off). Combining all these rules, in a few public offices and in a few companies like Orange, the resulting total, for certain employees, might be of 9.5 paid vacation weeks (5 weeks of vacation + 4 weeks of RTT + 0.5 week of bonus days off). Furthermore, there are [[Public holidays in France|11 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160222101724/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/Decentworkcheck-France-English.pdf ]{{cite web|url=http://www.thinkandask.com/2005/10191vacations.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060603230002/http://www.thinkandask.com/2005/10191vacations.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2006-06-03|title=TA: Vacation time France, United States|first=|last=webmaster-at-thinkandask.com|publisher=}} | style="text-align:center;"|25 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|36 |- |{{flag|Gabon}} |Workers are entitled to leave, to be paid by the employer, of 2 working days per month of effective service. The workers under the age of 18 are entitled to 2 and a half working days. Every worker is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Gabon|14 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|34 |- |{{flag|Gambia}} | | style="text-align:center;"|21 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Georgia}} | | style="text-align:center;"|24 | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|39 |- |{{flag|Germany}} |24 working days (defined as all calendar days that are not Sundays or public holidays). Therefore, a worker with a 5-day workweek has the right to 20 days off. However, it is quite customary that companies concede other 10 days of paid leave, bringing the average to 30 days off.{{Cite news|url=https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-germany-economy-holidays/german-workers-lead-europe-with-eight-weeks-of-leave-holidays-study-idUKKCN0QT1VV20150824|title=German workers lead Europe with eight weeks of leave, holidays - study|last=Editorial|first=Reuters|work=U.K.|access-date=2017-10-02|language=en-GB}} There is one national public holiday ([[German Unity Day]]). States regulate the remaining [[Public holidays in Germany|paid public holidays]] which vary between 9 and 13 in total, some of them being held nationwide.[https://web.archive.org/web/20170103094308/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/germany-english.pdf ] Bavaria and Baden-Württemberg provide the most.[[:de:Bundesurlaubsgesetz#Gesetzlicher Mindesturlaub]] The Bavarian city of Augsburg has 14 public holidays as it celebrates Friedensfest{{Cite journal|date=2017-08-09|title=Augsburger Hohes Friedensfest|url=https://de.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Augsburger_Hohes_Friedensfest&oldid=167996286|journal=Wikipedia|language=de}} in addition to the 13 holidays in Bavaria. Civil employees receive a minimum of 30 days after a law against [[Ageism|age discrimination]] was passed in 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.dw.de/dw/article/0,,15906072,00.html|title=Age discrimination also affects young workers - Germany - DW.COM - 24.04.2012|first=Deutsche Welle|last=(www.dw.com)|publisher=}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|29 |- |{{flag|Ghana}} |In any undertaking every worker is entitled to not less than 15 working days leave with full pay in any calendar year of continuous service. Every worker is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Ghana|13 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160224142659/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/Decentworkcheck-Ghana-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|28 |- |{{flag|Greece}} |Workers on a five-day week are entitled to a 20 working days or 24 working days for six-day week workers. The leave entitlement is increased by one working day for each year of employment in addition to the first year, up to 26 working days, or up to 22 working days if the undertaking operates a five-day week. There are [[Public holidays in Greece|9 mandatory paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160224155300/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/Decentworkcheck-Greece-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|29 |- |{{flag|Grenada}} |Workers are entitled to a period of annual leave with pay of not less than two weeks during the first year of employment and thereafter, three weeks. Every worker is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Grenada|13 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|23 |- |{{flag|Guatemala}} |Employees are entitled to have at least 15 working days of vacations.Código de Trabajo (Labour Code) Article 130 To have the right for vacations the worker must have at least 150 calendar days of continuous work.Código de Trabajo (Labour Code) Article 131 It is forbidden for a worker to accept extra payment instead of the vacations nor take another job during this time.Código de Trabajo (Labour Code) Article 133 Vacations must be paid in advance.Código de Trabajo (Labour Code) Article 132 Every employee is also entitled to [[Public holidays in Guatemala|10 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160224150200/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/latinamerica/Decentworkcheck-Guatemala-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|25 |- |{{flag|Guinea}} |The employee is entitled to leave, paid by the employer, at a rate of 2 and half days per month of effective service. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Guinea|11 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20170103094137/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/guinea-english.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|33 |- |{{flag|Guinea-Bissau}} |The annual leave shall be of 30 consecutive days, not counting weekly rest periods nor initial or final holidays. | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Guyana}} |Every worker being in employment shall be allowed a period of holidays with pay of not less than one day for each completed month of employment computed from the date of engagement. There are no legal provisions for pay on [[Public holidays in Guyana|public holidays]]{{cite web|url=http://www.ilo.org/ifpdial/information-resources/national-labour-law-profiles/WCMS_158900/lang--en/index.htm|title=National Labour Law Profile: Guyana|date=2011-06-17|website=www.ilo.org|language=en|access-date=2016-03-10}} | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"|12 |- |{{flag|Haiti}} |Any employee continuously working upon one year of service is entitled to paid leave of at least 15 consecutive days, comprising 13 working days and two Sundays. Public holidays and interruptions of work due to sickness or maternity enjoyed by the worker should not be deducted from the fifteen days off. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Haiti|16 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|16 | style="text-align:center;"|27 |- |{{flag|Honduras}} |The period of annual leave differs in relation to the time of work performed with the same employer: 10 consecutive working days after one year of service; 12 consecutive working days after two years' consecutive service; 15 consecutive working days after three years' consecutive service; 20 consecutive working days after four or more years' consecutive service. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Honduras|11 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20170103094304/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/latinamerica/honduras-english.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|8 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|19 |- |{{flag|Hong Kong}} the former {{flag|British Hong Kong}} |7 days (1 to 2 years), add one day per year until 14 days (3+ years).An employee is entitled to annual leave with pay after having been employed under a continuous contract for every 12 months. {{cite web|url=http://www.labour.gov.hk/eng/public/wcp/ConciseGuide/04.pdf|title=Chapter 4: Rest Days, Holidays and Leaves|work=A Concise Guide to the Employment Ordinance|publisher=Labour Department, Government of HKSAR|pages=|accessdate=2009-09-06}} Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Hong Kong|12 paid employee holidays]]. Some employee get 17 paid public holidays.{{cite web|title = Are all employees entitled to statutory holidays? Are employers required to have employees take leave on the day of statutory holiday?|url = http://www.1823.gov.hk/eng/FAQ/012015/index.shtm|website = www.1823.gov.hk|access-date = 2016-02-14}} | style="text-align:center;"|7 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|19 |- |{{flag|Hungary}} |20 working days (increasing up to 30 with age). The employee will get additional days for children. Two days for one child, 4 days for two children and 7 days for more than two children.{{cite web|url=http://www.kormany.hu/hu/nemzetgazdasagi-miniszterium/foglalkoztataspolitikaert-elelos-allamtitkarsag/hirek/tajekoztato-a-gyermekek-utani-szuloi-potszabadsagrol|title=Tájékoztató a gyermekek utáni szülői pótszabadságról|publisher=Ministry for National Economy|accessdate=2014-05-28|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140529051821/http://www.kormany.hu/hu/nemzetgazdasagi-miniszterium/foglalkoztataspolitikaert-elelos-allamtitkarsag/hirek/tajekoztato-a-gyermekek-utani-szuloi-potszabadsagrol|archivedate=2014-05-29|df=}} Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Hungary|13 paid public holidays]], however public holidays which happen on Saturday or Sunday are lost for the particular year.[https://web.archive.org/web/20160225112608/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/Decentworkcheck-Hungary-English.pdf ] Unpaid leave can be requested by the Employee that can be granted upon after Employer deliberation. Employee has a right for Unpaid leave under the following circumstances: Caring for child under 3 years (usually during maternity leave), caring for children under 10 years if it is necessary and the Employee receives child caring aid, long term caring for a relative up to a maximum of 2 years (requires official medical verification), volunteer reservist military service.{{cite web|url=http://ado.hu/rovatok/munkaugyek/mit-kell-tudni-a-fizetes-nelkuli-szabadsagrol|title=Mit kell tudni a fizetés nélküli szabadságról? - Munkaügyek - Adó Online|website=ado.hu}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|33 |- |{{flag|Iceland}} |The legislation provides for a minimum of two working days of holiday for each month in employment during the past holiday allowance year (May 1 to April 30). The minimum holiday for each year is therefore 24 working days. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Iceland|12 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=http://www.althingi.is/lagas/nuna/1987030.html|title=30/1987: Lög um orlof|publisher=}} | style="text-align:center;"|24 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|36 |- |{{flag|India}} |Adult workers in factories, mines, and plantations are entitled to one day off for every twenty days worked the previous year, which generally amounts to 12 days a year. Minors are entitled to 15 days. This does not apply to employees of factories of government-owned railways, who are governed by a separate set of leave entitlements decided by the government. Leave entitlements in India generally vary among states and industries, with local governments setting minimum leave entitlements and individual companies offering their own paid leave benefits. On average, Indians receive 24 days of paid leave a year. Employees are also entitled to 15-20 paid public holidays, depending on the region.Section 78 of the [http://www.indiankanoon.org/doc/1841141/ 1948 Factories Act]{{cite web|url=https://www.justlanded.com/english/India/India-Guide/Jobs/Working-conditions-in-India|title=Working conditions in India|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/mumbai/report-53-indians-feel-paid-vacation-time-given-to-them-not-fair-2013573|title=53% Indians feel paid vacation time given to them not fair - Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis|date=25 August 2014|publisher=}}[http://www.sannams4.com/paid-time-off-pto-information-holiday-rules-in-india/ Paid Time Off (PTO) Information – Holiday Rules in India] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150702080809/http://www.sannams4.com/paid-time-off-pto-information-holiday-rules-in-india/ |date=2015-07-02 }}Kant Sharma, Suresh and Sharma, Usha: ''Discovery of North-East India: Geography, History, Culture, Religion, Politics, Sociology, Science, Education and Economy. Tripura. Volume 11'', 161-162Sharma, Usha: ''Female Labour in India'', p. 14 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|27 |- |{{flag|Indonesia}} |Employees are entitled to a minimum of 12 days paid leave. They are also entitled to 15 public holidays. Public workers are entitled to 9 days of joint holiday (''cuti bersama''), whereas private employers can choose to follow joint holidays. After six years employment, employees are entitled to a month's worth of leave in their seventh and eighth year. There are no legal provisions for pay on [[Public holidays in Indonesia|public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160225090438/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/asia/Decentworkcheck-Indonesia-English.pdf][https://www.tiger-consulting.net/!tiger/documents/indonesia_employment_general_practices.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|27 |- |{{flag|Iran}} |The annual paid leave entitlement is one month, including four Fridays. | style="text-align:center;"|26 | style="text-align:center;"|27 | style="text-align:center;"|53 |- |{{flag|Iraq}} |A worker shall have a right to 20 days of leave for each year of work. A worker employed in work which is arduous or harmful to health shall have a right to 30 days of paid leave for each year of work. The length of a worker's annual leave shall be increased by 2 days after every additional 5 years of continuous service with the same employer.{{cite web|title=Travail Legal Database: Working Time in the Arab States Region|url=http://www.ilo.org/dyn/travail/travmain.sectionReport1?p_lang=en&p_structure=2&p_sc_id=1368&p_sc_id=1694&p_sc_id=1390&p_sc_id=1717&p_countries=REG2|website=Travail: Conditions of Work and Employment Programme|publisher=International Labour Organization|accessdate=16 September 2014}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Ireland}} |Employees are entitled to 4 weeks of paid annual leave and [[Public holidays in the Republic of Ireland|9 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|title=Leave and holidays|url=http://www.citizensinformation.ie/en/employment/employment_rights_and_conditions/leave_and_holidays/|website=Citizens Information|publisher=Citizens' Information Board of Ireland|accessdate=16 October 2014}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|29 |- |{{flag|Israel}} |A minimum of 12 days for employees with a five-day workweek and 14 days for employees with a six-day workweek. Following four years of employment, the number of vacation days rises by two per year.{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/minimum-number-of-vacation-days-rises-to-12-in-2017/|title=Minimum number of vacation days rises to 12 in 2017|publisher=}} An employee can accumulate a maximum of 28 vacation days under the law.{{cite web|url=https://www.lexology.com/library/detail.aspx?g=f5c5b969-fe64-45d6-82e9-1e0baeda99e1|title=Employment & labour law in Israel - Lexology|first=Barnea-Marie|last=Tsion|publisher=}} There are also [[Public holidays in Israel|9 paid public holidays]], and 4 holidays where, despite not being mandatory, many businesses and government offices offer collective or optional paid leave. | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|21 |- |{{flag|Italy}} |At least 20 working days (exact amount depends on contract details, all national category-specific contracts guarantee 28 days), entirely paid, plus up to 104 hours of ROL, that means the reduction of working time (in Italian Riduzione Orario di Lavoro), that have to be used primarily in blocks of a few hours each time for family/personal needs (for example taking a child to the doctor, going to the bank etc.) but may be utilized as well, just for the unused part of them and just if the company/the collective contract allows that, to get additional vacation hours/days, or to shorten of 1 or 2 hours the working day on Fridays. Employees also receive [[Public holidays in Italy|12 paid public holidays]], plus one town/city specific "patron saint day".[https://web.archive.org/web/20160225091745/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/Decentworkcheck-Italy-English.pdf ] Workers also have a right to 15 days of paid leave for their wedding.{{Cite news|url=https://www.ilo.org/ifpdial/information-resources/national-labour-law-profiles/WCMS_158903/lang--en/index.htm|title=National Labour Law Profile: Italy|date=2011-06-17|access-date=2018-11-13|language=en}} Employees have the right to paid leave to deal with sick children up to 3 years, or unpaid leave for older ones. A special provision{{Cite web|url=http://www.osservatoriodisabilita.it/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=292&Itemid=866&lang=en|title=Disability National Observatory - Law 104/92|last=Innamorati|first=Alessandra|website=www.osservatoriodisabilita.it|language=en-gb|access-date=2018-11-13}} allows people who are in charge of disabled children or relatives to have more days of paid leave. | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|32 |- |{{flag|Ivory Coast}} |The worker is entitled to annual leave, paid by the employer, at the rate of 2 working days per month of effective service. Young workers under the age of 18 are entitled to two and 2/10 working days per month of effective service. The annual leave is increased at the rate of 2 days after 15 years of seniority in the same company; 4 days after 20 years of seniority in the same company; 6 days after 25 years of seniority in the same company; and 8 days after 30 years of seniority in the same company. Employees also receive [[Public holidays in Ivory Coast|14 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|34 |- |{{flag|Jamaica}} |Workers who have worked up to 220 days enjoy 10 days maximum (if they have worked for a minimum of 110 days) calculated as follows; 1/22 of the number of days of work. Any fraction of a day of holiday shall be reckoned as 1 day. For workers who have worked more than 220 days: 2 working weeks. For workers with 10 years of service or more and who have worked more than 220 days in each qualifying year: 3 working weeks. | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Japan}} |The initial annual leave entitlement is 10 days of leave. Workers who have been employed continuously for at least one and half years shall be granted one additional day of leave for each year of service, up to a maximum of 20 days of leave.{{cite web|url=http://www.japaneselawtranslation.go.jp/law/detail_main?re=01&vm=&id=5#en_ch4at16|title=労働基準法 / Labor Standards Act|publisher=}} There are no legal provisions for pay on [[Public holidays in Japan|public holidays]].{{cite web|title = National Labour Law Profile: Japan|url = http://www.ilo.org/ifpdial/information-resources/national-labour-law-profiles/WCMS_158904/lang--en/index.htm|website = www.ilo.org|date = 2011-06-17|access-date = 2016-02-24|language = en}} | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|25 |- |{{flag|Jersey}} |Employees are entitled to two weeks of paid annual leave.{{cite web|url=http://www.jacs.org.je/legislation/employment-(jersey)-law-2003/minimum-rest-periods-and-annual-leave/|title=Minimum Rest Periods and Annual Leave: JACS - Jersey Advisory Conciliation Service|website=www.jacs.org.je|access-date=2016-04-07}} Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Jersey|9 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=http://www.gov.je/Leisure/Events/WhatsOn/Pages/BankHolidayDates.aspx|title=Bank holiday dates|last=Jersey|first=States of|website=www.gov.je|access-date=2016-04-07}} | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|19 |- |{{flag|Jordan}} |Each employee shall be entitled to an annual leave with full pay for fourteen 14 days per each year of service, increased to 21 days after five years of service. | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|10-14 | style="text-align:center;"|24-28 |- |{{flag|Kazakhstan}} |Employees are entitled to 24 calendar days of paid annual leave.{{cite web|url=http://www.pavlodar.com/zakon/?dok=03549&all=all|title=Трудовой кодекс Республики Казахстан Кодекс Республики Казахстан от 15.05.2007 N 251-III ЗРК|publisher=}} | style="text-align:center;"|18 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Kenya}} |An employee is entitled to not less than 21 working days after every 12 consecutive months of service with his employer. Where employment is terminated after then completion of two or more consecutive months of service during any 12 months of leave-earning period, to not less than 1.75 days of leave for each completed month of service. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Kenya|10 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|21 | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|28 |- |{{flag|Kiribati}} | | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|South Korea}} |15 days[http://www.moel.go.kr/english/topic/laborlaw_view.jsp?idx=254&tab=Standards Article 60, Labor Standard Act] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130530165436/http://www.moel.go.kr/english/topic/laborlaw_view.jsp?idx=254&tab=Standards |date=2013-05-30 }} and for workers who have worked 3 years, one day will be added to every two years continuously worked up to a maximum of 25 days. Despite the employment law, it is strictly regulated to use a paid leave due to Korean culture, which is often perceived as hierarchical. Generally, it is a common sense that workers only get a few days off for a year regardless of how many off days are left, though extra bonuses might be paid out for the work.{{cite web|url=http://terms.naver.com/entry.nhn?docId=1132136&cid=40942&categoryId=31705|title=유급휴가|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.justlanded.com/english/South-Korea/South-Korea-Guide/Jobs/Working-in-South-Korea|title=Working in South Korea|publisher=}} | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Kosovo}} |Labor Law mandates at least 20 days of paid annual leave during a calendar year{{Cite web|url=http://www.assembly-kosova.org/common/docs/ligjet/2010-212-eng.pdf|title=Law No.03/L –212 on Labour (Republic of Kosovo)|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}}. In addition, employees get one additional day of paid annual leave for every 5 years of service, whereas civil servants get one day of annual leave for every 2 years of service{{Cite web|url=http://www.kuvendikosoves.org/common/docs/ligjet/2010-149-eng.pdf|title=Law No.03/L –149 on the Civil Service of the Republic of Kosovo|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}}. Employees are entitled to 12 paid days of public holidays. If public holidays fall on Saturday or Sunday, the following working day is a non-working day.{{Cite web|url=http://www.assembly-kosova.org/common/docs/ligjet/2008_03-L064_en.pdf|title=Law No. 03/L-064 on Official Holidays in the Republic of Kosovo|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|32 |- |{{flag|Kuwait}} | Every worker is entitled to enjoy a paid annual leave of 30 days. In addition, the worker who completes 2 continuous years in the service of his employer shall be entitled to a paid leave of 21 days for performing Haj rituals, provided that he should not have previously performed the Haj. Workers are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Kuwait|13 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=http://news.kuwaittimes.net/website/labor-law-85-2017-amends-law-6-2016/|title=Labor law 85 of 2017 amends law 6 of 2016 - Kuwait Times|date=9 July 2017|publisher=}} | style="text-align:center;"|30 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|43 |- |{{flag|Kyrgyzstan}} | | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Laos}} |The general annual leave entitlement is 15 days of leave per year. | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Latvia}} |Employees are entitled to 4 calendar weeks of paid annual leave. | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|32 |- |{{flag|Lebanon}} | Every wage-earner or salary-earner employed in an establishment for at least one year is entitled to an annual leave of 15 days with full pay. | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Lesotho}} |An employee shall be entitled to one working day of holiday in respect of each month of continuous employment with the same employer, i.e. a minimum of 12 working days of holiday in each year. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Lesotho|10 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|22 |- |{{flag|Liberia}} |Employees are entitled to: (a) For continuous service with the same employer for twenty-four months, the number of working days in two weeks, and thereafter for each additional twelve months, with the same employer, the number of working days in three (3) weeks; and (b) For continuous service with the same employer for sixty months and thereafter, the number of working days in four weeks. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Liberia|11 paid public holidays]].{{cite web |url=http://www.ten.org.lr/doc/Liberia%20Labor%20Law.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-03-05 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160321095142/http://ten.org.lr/doc/Liberia%20Labor%20Law.pdf |archivedate=2016-03-21 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.cbl.org.lr/content_main.php?sub=holidays|title=Central Bank of Liberia|website=www.cbl.org.lr|access-date=2016-03-05}} | style="text-align:center;"|10Paid vacation becomes available after two years with same employer. | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|21 |- |{{flag|Libya}} |Every worker is entitled annually to 30 days leave.
