Workers who have reached the age of 50 or have completed 20 years of service are entitled 45 days. | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Lithuania}} |Employees are entitled to 28 calendar days of paid annual leave.{{cite web|url=http://www3.lrs.lt/pls/inter3/dokpaieska.showdoc_l?p_id=350635#straipsnis166|title=Lietuvos Respublikos Seimas - Dokumento tekstas|publisher=}} Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Lithuania|14 paid public holidays]].{{Cite book|title = European Social Charter (revised): European Committee of Social Rights, Conclusions (2010)|url = https://books.google.com/books?id=ndFVmSBqreYC|publisher = Council of Europe|date = 2011-10-06|isbn = 9789287171498|language = en|first = Council of Europe: European Committee of Social|last = Rights|page = 346}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|34 |- |{{flag|Luxembourg}} |The legal duration of annual leave is set to 25 working days per year. Supplementary leave of 6 days for workers with disabilities and for physically or mentally disabled persons. Workers are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Luxembourg|10 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=http://www.luxembourg.public.lu/en/practical-issues/public-holidays/index.html |title=Data |date= |accessdate= |website=www.luxembourg.public.lu |publisher= |last= |first= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141222212724/http://www.luxembourg.public.lu/en/practical-issues/public-holidays/index.html |archivedate=2014-12-22 |df= }} Extraordinary paid leave - which is not deducted from the 25-day annual leave allowance if taken - is granted in certain personal circumstances. In some cases, the number of days granted depends on whether an employee works in the public or private sector.{{cite web|url=https://guichet.public.lu/en/citoyens/travail-emploi/conges-jours-feries/situation-personnelle/conge-extraordinaire.html |title=Applying for leave for personal reasons (special leave) |date= |accessdate= |website=guichet.public.lu |df= }} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Type of extraordinary leave !! Civil servants !! Private-sector employees |- | Marriage || 6 days || 6 days |- | Civil partnership || 6 days || 1 day |- | Death of spouse/civil partner || 3 days || 3 days |- | Death of parent or adult child || 3 days || 3 days |- | Death of child under 18 || - || 5 days |- | Marriage of child || 2 days || 1 day |- | Moving house (''once per 3-year period'') || 2 days || 2 days |- | Adoption of child under 16 || 2 days || 10 days |- | Birth of child (for father only) || 2 days || 10 days |- | Enlisting for military service || 1 day || - |- | Death of sibling, grandparent or grandchild || 3 days || 1 day |} | style="text-align:center;"|25 | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|35 |- |{{flag|Macedonia}} |Employees are entitled to 20-26 working days, as specified in a collective agreement in accordance with years of service and working conditions; 3 additional days for older workers. | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Madagascar}} |Workers are entitled to leave paid by the employer at 2.5 days per month and are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Madagascar|13 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|35 |- |{{flag|Malawi}} | | style="text-align:center;"|18 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Malaysia}} |Starts at 8 days per year for first 2 years employment with an employer. Increases to 12 days per year for between 2 and 5 years employment and 16 days per year for 5 or more years. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Malaysia|19 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|19 | style="text-align:center;"|26 |- |{{flag|Maldives}} | | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Mali}} | | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Malta}} |Every worker is entitled to paid annual leave of at least the equivalent in hours of four weeks and four working days calculated on the basis of a 40-hour working week and 8-hour working day. Workers are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Malta|14 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|25 | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|39 |- |{{flag|Marshall Islands}} | | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Mauritania}} |After the reference period of 12 months, a worker is entitled to 1.5 days of leave per month of effective service. An exception is 3 days per month for employees whose normal residence is not in Mauritania. One additional day annual leave is granted for 10–15 years of seniority, two additional days for 15–20 years seniority and 3 days for a seniority exceeding 20 years. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Mauritania|7 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|7 | style="text-align:center;"|22 |- |{{flag|Mauritius}} |Every worker, other than a part-time worker, who remains in continuous employment with the same employer for a period of 12 consecutive months is entitled, during each subsequent period of 12 months while he remains in continuous employment, to 20 working days of annual leave or such similar leave under any other name. Besides that every worker is entitled to an extra 2 days of leave in every year and [[Public holidays in Mauritius|16 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|16 | style="text-align:center;"|38 |- |{{flag|Mexico}} |The duration of the annual leave is set at 6 working days minimum, after one year of service with the same employer. This duration shall be increased by two working days (up to a maximum of 12) for each subsequent year of service. After the fourth year, the vacation period shall be increased by two days for every five years of service. Workers who perform discontinuous and seasonal work are entitled to an annual holiday period in proportion to the number of the working days performed in the year. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Mexico|7 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|6 | style="text-align:center;"|7 | style="text-align:center;"|13 |- |{{flag|Micronesia}} | | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Moldova}} |All employees have the right to an annual paid holiday, with duration of not less than 28 calendar days without taking into account the non working holidays. Employees of special sectors (education, health service, public service, etc.) can be granted annual leave of a different duration. There are no legal provisions for pay on [[Public holidays in Moldova|public holidays]].{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ndFVmSBqreYC|title=European Social Charter (revised): European Committee of Social Rights, Conclusions (2010)|last=Rights|first=Council of Europe: European Committee of Social|date=2011-10-06|publisher=Council of Europe|isbn=9789287171498|page=410|language=en}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"|20 |- |{{flag|Mongolia}} |15 working days for the 1 year of employment. Increase up to 29 working days after 32 years of employment. 48 working days paid vacation for teachers and professors for all levels of school, kindergarten and university regardless of the number of years of service. There are no identified legal provisions for pay on [[Public holidays in Mongolia|public holidays]].{{cite web|url=http://www.legalinfo.mn/law/details/9020?lawid=9020|title=..:: www.Legalinfo.mn - Хуулийн нэгдсэн портал сайт ::..|publisher=}} | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"|15 |- |{{flag|Montenegro}} | | style="text-align:center;"|21 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Morocco}} |Every employee, having worked at least 6 months continuously in the same company, is entitled to paid annual leave as it follows: 1 and 1/2 day of effective work for every month of service; and 2 days of effective work for every month of service for those aged under 18. The paid annual leave is increased in one and a half day of effective work for an entire period, continue or not, of 5 years of service. However, this increase cannot be accumulated when the total annual leave has reached the limit of 30 working days. An "effective day of work" day is that which is not a weekly rest day, a holiday and general holidays of the company. The working month is defined as: 26 effective working days or 191 working hours in the non agricultural sector or 208 in the agricultural sector. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Morocco|10 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|25 |- |{{flag|Mozambique}} |Employees are entitled to one day for every month of actual service, during the first year of service; two days for every month of actual service, during the second year of service; and thirty days for every year of actual service, from the third year onward. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Mozambique|9 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160225093232/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/Decentworkcheck-Mozambique-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|19 |- |{{flag|Myanmar}} |Employees over the age of 15 years are entitled to 10 consecutive days of leave per year. Employees under the age of 15 years are entitled to 14 consecutive days leave per year. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Myanmar|14 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|24 |- |{{flag|Namibia}} |Every employee is entitled to at least four consecutive weeks annual leave in respect of each annual leave cycle (which means the period of 12 consecutive months employment with the same employer immediately following an employee`s commencement of employment or the completion of the last annual leave cycle). If the number of days in an ordinary workweek are 6 the annual leave entitlement in working days is 24. | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Nauru}} |No paid annual leave.{{cite web|url=http://www.worldpolicycenter.org/data-tables/policy/is-paid-annual-leave-available-to-workers|title=WORLD Policy Analysis Center|website=WORLD Policy Analysis Center|access-date=2016-05-22}} | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Nepal}} |Every employee is entitled to paid home leave at the rate of 1 day for every 20 days that he works. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Nepal|13 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|28 |- |{{flag|Netherlands}} |Workers are entitled to four times the number of days they work per week. In this respect, for a five-day working week the worker is entitled to 20 days of annual leave.{{cite web|url=http://www.expatax.nl/workcontracts.php|title=Employment contract in the Netherlands.|first=Arjan|last=Enneman|publisher=}} There are no legal provisions for pay on [[Public holidays in the Netherlands|public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160225112611/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/Decentworkcheck-Netherlands-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|8 | style="text-align:center;"|28 |- |{{flag|New Zealand}} |Employees are entitled to not less than 4 weeks of paid annual holiday. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in New Zealand|11 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|title=Holidays and leave|url=http://www.dol.govt.nz/er/holidaysandleave/index.asp|website=Labour Information|publisher=Ministry of Business, Innovation, and Employment|accessdate=16 October 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140906090727/http://www.dol.govt.nz/er/holidaysandleave/index.asp|archivedate=6 September 2014|df=}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|31 |- |{{flag|Nicaragua}} |Every worker is entitled to enjoy 15 days of continuous and remunerated annual leave after 6 months of uninterrupted work with the same employer. Workers are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Nicaragua|9 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|20 |- |{{flag|Niger}} |Workers are entitled to 30 calendar days (two and a half calendar days per month of work). Seniority entitles a worker to additional days of leave: 2 additional days after 20 years with the same enterprise; 4 additional days after 25 years; 6 additional days after 30 years. Workers are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Nigeria|12 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|34 |- |{{flag|Nigeria}} |Every worker is entitled after twelve months continuous service to a holiday with full pay of at least six working days. | style="text-align:center;"|5 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Norway}} |Employers are required that employees have 25 working days of leave in connection with holidays each holiday year. Holiday leave is accrued from previous full year of employment, ie in the first year of employment, a worker is entitled to 25 working days of leave, but they will be unpaid. After one year of full employment, the employee shall be entitled to 25 working days of paid holidays. All days count as working days except Sundays and statutory church or public holidays. {{Cite web|url=https://www.arbeidstilsynet.no/en/working-conditions/holiday/|title=holiday|last=|first=|date=|website=www.arbeidstilsynet.no|language=no|access-date=2018-10-01}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.nyinorge.no/en/Ny-i-Norge-velg-sprak/New-in-Norway/Work/Employment/Holidays-and-holiday-pay/|title=Holidays and holiday pay|last=nyinorge.no|date=2009-11-13|website=www.nyinorge.no|language=en|access-date=2018-12-01}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.uio.no/english/for-employees/employment/payments/holiday-pay/calculation-examples.html|title=Examples of how pay is calculated in June - For employees - University of Oslo|website=www.uio.no|language=en|access-date=2018-12-01}} | style="text-align:center;"|25 | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|35 |- |{{flag|Oman}} |Employees are entitled to 30 days of annual leave and are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Oman|9 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160324180402/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/gulf-middle-east/Decentworkcheck-Oman-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|31 |- |{{flag|Pakistan}} |Factory workers, employees of commercial establishments, and road transportation workers are entitled to 14 days of holidays, inclusive of weekly rest days, provided they complete a full year of continuous employment. Those who spend more than 90 days on sickness, accident, or authorized leave, and one day or more on unauthorized leave or on an illegal strike lose this entitlement. Mine workers are entitled to one day of leave for every 17 days of work below ground and one day for every 20 days worked above ground, generally amounting to more than 14 days. Newspaper employees are not entitled to a fixed set of days by law, but rather to paid leave lasting at least 1/11th as long as they spend on duty. Factory workers are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Pakistan|17 paid public holidays]]. On average, corporations and government offices provide at least 15 paid public holidays per year.{{cite web|url=http://www.paycheck.pk/main/labour-laws/work-time-holiday/annual-leave/annual-leave-and-working-on-holidays|title=Annual Leave in Pakistan - Working on Holidays in Pakistan|publisher=}}Cavendish, Marshall, ''World and Its Peoples'' (2006), p. 392 | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|29 |- |{{flag|Palau}} | | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Palestine}} | | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Panama}} |Employees are entitled to enjoy 30 days of annual leave and are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Panama|10 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|30 | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|40 |- |{{flag|Papua New Guinea}} |Employees are entitled to 14 consecutive days of annual leave, including non-working days. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Papua New Guinea|9 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|19 |- |{{flag|Paraguay}} |Every worker shall be entitled to a paid annual leave after a year of work within same employer that shall be at least: a) 12 consecutive working days for workers with less than 5 years of continuous service; b) 18 consecutive working days after 5 years and less than 10 years of continuous service; c) 30 consecutive days after 10 years of continuous service. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Paraguay|12 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160324194434/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/latinamerica/Decentworkcheck-Paraguay-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|22 |- |{{flag|Peru}} |Employees are entitled to 30 calendar days of annual leave and are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Peru|12 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|34 |- |{{flag|Philippines}} |Employees are entitled to 5 days of paid service incentive leave per year.{{cite web|url=http://www.lilkuya.com/service-incentive-leave-vacation-leave/|title=Service Incentive Leave and Vacation Leave in the Philippines|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=|access-date=}} Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in the Philippines|11 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|5 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|16 |- |{{flag|Poland}} |20 working days per year during the first 10 years of employment and 26 working days thereafter. Secondary and tertiary education partially counts towards employment time,{{cite web|url=http://www.infor.pl/prawo/praca/urlopy-pracownicze/286172,Czy-studia-wliczaja-sie-do-stazu-pracy.html|title=Czy studia wliczają się do stażu pracy?|publisher=}} ranging from 3 years for basic vocational school, up to 8 years for bachelor's degree. Workers are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Poland|13 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=http://publicholidays.eu/poland/|title=Poland Public Holidays 2016 and 2017|publisher=}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|33 |- |{{flag|Portugal}} |Workers are entitled to paid holidays which are mandatory and have a minimum duration of 22 working days. Workers are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Portugal|13 paid public holidays]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/jan/08/portugals-socialist-government-restores-holidays-cut-during-austerity-drive|title=Portugal's socialist government restores holidays cut during austerity drive|last=|first=|date=January 8, 2016|work=The Guardian|accessdate=May 2, 2016}} | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|35 |- |{{flag|Puerto Rico}} |Employees are entitled to 15 days of paid annual leave. There are no legal provisions for pay on [[Public holidays in Puerto Rico|public holidays]].http://www.lawforchange.org/images/lfc/PuertoRicoEmployment.pdf{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"|15 |- |{{flag|Qatar}} |Annual leave shall not be less than three weeks for the worker whose service is less than five years and four weeks for the worker whose service is more than five years. Workers are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Qatar|10 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|25 |- |{{flag|Romania}} |Workers are entitled to a minimum of 20 days of paid leave per year; 23 for the handicapped, underage, or those working in difficult or dangerous conditions. Varying amounts of extra paid days are available for life events such as marriage or death in the family, child birth (for the partner who is not on paternal/maternal leave), donating blood, or workplace relocation. Workers are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Romania|13 paid public holidays]];[https://web.archive.org/web/20160302104033/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/Decentworkcheck-Romania-English.pdf] as well as up to 90 days of unpaid leave every year for the purpose of preparation for educational degree exams. Unpaid leave can also be requested for any other reason, but the employer is not legally obligated to agree. | style="text-align:center;"|21 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|34 |- |{{flag|Russia}} |Workers are entitled to 28 calendar days (including Saturdays and Sundays) of annual leave and [[Public holidays in Russia|14 paid public holidays]]. This usually translates into 33 working days of leave because most holidays coinciding with weekend days are moved to the following working day.{{cite web|title=Labour Code of Russia §112|url=http://www.consultant.ru/document/cons_doc_LAW_34683/98ef2900507766e70ff29c0b9d8e2353ea80a1cf/|website=Russian Law Database by Consulant Plus|accessdate=26 May 2018|ref=RussianConsultantDatabase}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|34 |- |{{flag|Rwanda}} |Employees are entitled to a paid leave at the employer's expenses, on the basis of one and a half working days per month of effective continued work. Official holidays are not considered as part of the annual paid leave. The employee benefits from one working day per year of annual paid leave for every three years of experience in the same institution. However, annual paid leave, in any case, can not exceed twenty one (21) working days. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Rwanda|11 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160302104718/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/Decentworkcheck-Rwanda-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|26 |- |{{flag|Samoa}} |Employees are entitled to at least 10 days’ paid annual leave to be taken on days mutually agreed between the employer and the employee.{{cite web|url=http://www.ilo.org/wcmsp5/groups/public/---ed_protect/---protrav/---ilo_aids/documents/legaldocument/wcms_201328.pdf |title=Data |website=www.ilo.org |format=PDF}} Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Samoa|11 paid public holidays]].{{cite web |url=http://www.mcil.gov.ws/irosh_wp/forms/notice_public%20holidays%202011-14.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-03-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140514114358/http://www.mcil.gov.ws/irosh_wp/forms/notice_public%20holidays%202011-14.pdf |archivedate=2014-05-14 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://sobserver.ws/en/17_02_2016/local/2500/Two-public-holidays-declared.htm|title=Two public holidays declared|website=Samoa Observer|access-date=2016-03-09}} | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|21 |- |{{flag|Saint Kitts and Nevis}} |Every worker shall be entitled to a paid annual leave of not less than 14 days, after one year of employment. Sundays and public holidays shall not be included in the annual leave period and so this period shall be increased by one day for each Sunday or public holiday occurring therein. | style="text-align:center;"|12 | | |- |{{flag|Saint Lucia}} |Employees are entitled to 14 working days of paid annual leave after a minimum employment of twelve months; after five years employees are entitled to 21 working days. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Saint Lucia|13 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=http://www.govt.lc/media.govt.lc/www/resources/legislation/SaintLuciaLabourCode2006.pdf |title=Labour Code 2006.pmd |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=2018-07-25}}{{cite web|url=http://www.stluciachamber.org/services.php|title=Welcome to St Lucia Chamber of Commerce, Industry and Agriculture|website=www.stluciachamber.org|access-date=2016-03-07|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160308061447/http://www.stluciachamber.org/services.php|archive-date=2016-03-08|dead-url=yes|df=}} | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|27 |- |{{flag|Saint Vincent and the Grenadines}} | | style="text-align:center;"|16 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|San Marino}} |All workers are entitled to annual leave with pay, varying from 1 to more than 15 years of service from 10 to 20 days a year for wage earners and from 1 to more than 12 years of service from 10 to 12 days a year for salaried employees and intermediary staff. | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|São Tomé and Príncipe}} |Workers are entitled to 30 consecutive days of annual leave, not counting weekly rest periods nor initial or final holidays. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in São Tomé and Príncipe|9 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|25 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|34 |- |{{flag|Saudi Arabia}} |A worker shall be entitled to a prepaid annual leave of not less than twenty one days, to be increased to a period of not less than thirty days if the worker spends five consecutive years in the service of the employer. Workers are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Saudi Arabia|10 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|21 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|30 |- |{{flag|Senegal}} |Workers are entitled to 2 days of annual leave for each month of work performed over a year. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Senegal|12 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160302105853/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/Decentworkcheck-Senegal-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|32 |- |{{flag|Serbia}} |20 working days minimum (effectively 4 weeks, law defines working week as 5 working days for purpose of paid vacation), plus 9 bank holidays and up to two more days depending on religion of employee. | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|31 |- |{{flag|Seychelles}} |A worker is entitled to 21 days of paid annual leave or, where the employment is for less than a year, to 1.75 days for each month of employment, the aggregate number of days being rounded up upon addition to the highest integer. | style="text-align:center;"|21 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|34 |- |{{flag|Sierra Leone}} | | style="text-align:center;"|18 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Singapore}} |A worker is entitled to minimum 7 days, with 1 additional day per year up to a minimum of 14 days. No statutory minimum leave for seamen, domestic workers, or employees in managerial or executive positions. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Singapore|11 paid public holidays]].{{Cite web |url=http://statutes.agc.gov.sg/non_version/cgi-bin/cgi_retrieve.pl?actno=REVED-91&doctitle=EMPLOYMENT%20ACT%0A&date=latest&method=part |title=Archived copy |access-date=2011-05-26 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110810002123/http://statutes.agc.gov.sg/non_version/cgi-bin/cgi_retrieve.pl?actno=REVED-91&doctitle=EMPLOYMENT%20ACT%0A&date=latest&method=part |archive-date=2011-08-10 |dead-url=yes |df= }}{{cite web|title=Annual Leave|url=http://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/leave-and-holidays/Pages/annual-leave.aspx|website=Ministry of Power|publisher=Singapore Government|accessdate=16 October 2014}} | style="text-align:center;"|7 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|18 |- |{{flag|Slovakia}} |The duration of the paid annual leave is at least four weeks, provided that seven consecutive calendar days is understood as one week paid holiday. The annual leave period of an employee of 33 years old or over at the end of the applicable calendar year is at least five weeks. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Slovakia|15 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160302104353/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/Decentworkcheck-Slovakia-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|35 |- |{{flag|Slovenia}} |A worker has the right to annual leave in an individual calendar year, which may not be shorter than 4 weeks, regardless of whether he works full-time or part-time. Older people get five more days, mother with children gets three to five more days. Maxium leave is 35 days per year. Sundays and public holidays are not counted to the leave. They are free for all. | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|33 |- |{{flag|Solomon Islands}} |Each worker is entitled to be given by his employer a holiday at the rate of not less than 1.25 working days for each complete calendar month of employment in an undertaking. | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"|15 |- |{{flag|Somalia}} |Workers are entitled to 15 days of paid annual leave and are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Somalia|9 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|22 |- |{{flag|South Africa}} |21 consecutive days, or 1 day for every 17 days worked, or 1 hour for every 17 hours worked,{{cite web|url=http://www.labour.gov.za/legislation/acts/basic-guides/basic-guide-to-annual-leave|title=Basic Guide to Annual Leave — Department of Labour|publisher=}} Regular workers may take a further 3 days of family responsibility leave. Leave legislation does not apply to members of the National Defence Force, National Intelligence Agency, South African Secret Service or unpaid volunteers working for a charity.{{cite web|url=http://www.labour.gov.za/legislation/acts/basic-guides/basic-guide-to-family-responsibility-leave|title=Basic Guide to Family Responsibility Leave — Department of Labour|publisher=}} Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in South Africa|12 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=http://www.labour.gov.za/DOL/legislation/acts/basic-guides/basic-guide-to-public-holidays|title=Basic Guide to Public Holidays — Department of Labour|publisher=}} | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|27 |- |{{flag|South Sudan}} |Employees are entitled to paid annual leave for every year of service: 20 days for one to three years of continuous service; 25 days for eight to (less than) fifteen years of continuous service; and 30 days for 15 or more years of service with the employer. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in South Sudan|12 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160302104350/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/Decentworkcheck-South%20Sudan-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|32 |- |{{flag|Spain}} |Workers are entitled to 22 working days of annual leave and [[Public holidays in Spain|14 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=http://www.elpais.com/articulo/economia/Merkel/quiere/armonicen/vacaciones/jubilacion/UE/elpepueco/20110518elpepueco_2/Tes|title=Merkel quiere que se armonicen vacaciones y jubilación en la UE|first=Ediciones El|last=País|date=18 May 2011|publisher=}} | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|36 |- |{{flag|Sri Lanka}} |In practice, most of the religious and festival holidays are available with most jobs having 20 days paid leave and 20 public holidays. However shop and office employees are entitled to a minimum of 14 days of annual leave for each year of employment and are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Sri Lanka|8 paid public holidays]].[http://www.labourdept.gov.lk/Legislations/Shop%20&%20Office%20Employees.pdf Shop and Offices Act] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100215143234/http://www.labourdept.gov.lk/Legislations/Shop%20%26%20Office%20Employees.pdf |date=2010-02-15 }} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|40 |- |{{flag|Sudan}} |Workers are entitled to annual leave as follows: 20 days if a worker has been continuously employed by his employer for a period of one to three years; 25 days if a worker has spent eight years or less than 15 years of continuous service with his employer; 30 days if a worker has spent 15 or more years of continuous service with his employer. | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Suriname}} | | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Swaziland}} |An employee is entitled to no less than two weeks of holiday for every 12 months of employment with an employer. | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Sweden}} |Employees are entitled to 25 work days of annual leave. There are no legal provisions for pay on [[Public holidays in Sweden|public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160324193142/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/Decentworkcheck-Sweden-English.pdf ] Although, common practice is that you get paid on public holidays as well. | style="text-align:center;"|25 | style="text-align:center;"|9 | style="text-align:center;"|34 |- |{{flag|Switzerland}} |Employees over 20 years of age are entitled to 4 weeks, under 20 are entitled to 5 weeks. Employees are also entitled to depending on the canton [[Public holidays in Switzerland|7–15 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|title = Legal entitlement to holidays in Switzerland - www.ch.ch|url = https://www.ch.ch/en/holidays-and-public-holidays/|website = www.ch.ch|access-date = 2016-02-22}}[https://web.archive.org/web/20160304131317/http://www.ejpd.admin.ch/dam/data/bj/publiservice/service/zivilprozessrecht/kant-feiertage.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|7 | style="text-align:center;"|27 |- |{{flag|Syria}} | Employees are entitled to one annual leave of twenty-four working days, with full pay, after 1 to 5 years of employment; twenty-one working days, after 5 to 10 years of employment; and thirty working days, after 10 or more years of employment or when they are over 50. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Syria|13 paid public holidays]]. | style="text-align:center;"|24 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|37 |- |{{flag|Taiwan}} |3 days (half year to 1 year), 7 days (1 year), 10 days (2 years), 14 days (3 to 4 years), 15 days (5 to 9 years), and one additional day per year until 30 days (10+ years). | style="text-align:center;"|7 | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|19 |- |{{flag|Tanzania}} |An employer is required to grant an employee at least 28 consecutive days of leave in respect of each 12-month period of employment, and such leave is inclusive of any public holiday that may fall within the period of leave. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Tanzania|17 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mywage.org/tanzania/home/in-the-workplace/work-time-and-holiday|title=Annual Leave, Holiday Pay, Weekly Rest Days - Tanzania - Mywage.org/Tanzania|website=www.mywage.org|access-date=2016-03-03}} | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|17 | style="text-align:center;"|37 |- |{{flag|Thailand}} |Annual leave shall be for a period of not less than 6 working days following the employee's first year of employment. In subsequent years, the employer may fix the annual vacation at more than 6 working days for an employee. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Thailand|13 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=http://protection.labour.go.th/doc/%E0%B8%AA%E0%B8%B4%E0%B8%97%E0%B8%98%E0%B8%B4%E0%B8%99%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%A2%E0%B8%88%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%87%E0%B8%A5%E0%B8%B9%E0%B8%81%E0%B8%88%E0%B9%89%E0%B8%B2%E0%B8%87-%E0%B8%AD%E0%B8%B1%E0%B8%87%E0%B8%81%E0%B8%A4%E0%B8%A9.pdf|title=Rights and Duties Employer and Employee, Labour Protection Bureau Department of Labour Protection and Welfare Ministry of Labour, Thailand|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.panwagroup.net/business/index2.html|title=Labour laws, rules, regulations in Thailand|publisher=}} | style="text-align:center;"|6 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|19 |- |{{flag|East Timor}} | | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Togo}} |Workers are entitled to two and a half days per month. There are no legal provisions for pay on [[Public holidays in Togo|public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160302103935/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/Decentworkcheck-Togo-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"|22 |- |{{flag|Tonga}} |The Tongan government is working on legislation to provide for paid vacation time.{{cite web|url=http://www.mctl.gov.to/wp-content/uploads/2013/04/Final-Draft-ERB-2013-April-20131-19Apr13.pdf|title=This website is currently unavailable.|website=www.mctl.gov.to}} | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Trinidad and Tobago}} |All workers in general are entitled to 14 consecutive days holiday with pay at the expiration of each complete year. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Trinidad and Tobago|14 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=http://www.ilo.org/ifpdial/information-resources/national-labour-law-profiles/WCMS_158855/lang--en/index.htm|title=National labour law profile: Trinidad and Tobago|date=2011-06-17|website=www.ilo.org|language=en|access-date=2016-03-10}}[https://web.archive.org/web/20120531111327/http://rgd.legalaffairs.gov.tt/Laws2/Alphabetical_List/lawspdfs/19.05.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|14 | style="text-align:center;"|24 |- |{{flag|Tunisia}} |All workers who perform at least 1 month of work during the reference year are entitled to enjoy 1 day of leave per month with a total duration not exceeding 15 days, of which 12 will be working days. Workers are entitled to additional leave days as follows; 1 day yearly for every 5 years of work with the same employer to a maximum of 18 days. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Tunisia|6 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160302114523/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/Decentworkcheck-Tunisia-20151209-%20English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|6 | style="text-align:center;"|16 |- |{{flag|Turkey}} |14 work days (Saturdays are counted as workdays) for 1–5 years, 20 work days for 6–15 years and 26 days for over 15 years seniority. There are a total of [[Public holidays in Turkey|14.5 paid public holiday]]s, but if these holidays fall on Sundays or other off-days of a worker, they are not carried over to the next workday.[https://web.archive.org/web/20160302110605/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/Decentworkcheck-Turkey-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|14.5 | style="text-align:center;"|26.5 |- |{{flag|Uganda}} |An employee, once in every calendar year, is entitled to a holiday with full pay at the rate of seven days in respect of each period of a continuous four months' service. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Uganda|13 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|title = Annual Leave, Holiday Pay, Weekly Rest Days - Uganda - Mywage.ug|url = http://mywage.ug/home/labour-laws/work-time-holiday|website = mywage.ug|access-date = 2016-02-14}}[https://web.archive.org/web/20161029111706/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/uganda-english.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|13 | style="text-align:center;"|28 |- |{{flag|Ukraine}} |Employees are entitled to 24 calendar days of paid annual leave.{{cite web|url=http://www.ilo.org/dyn/normlex/en/f?p=1000:11300:0::NO:11300:P11300_INSTRUMENT_ID:312277|title=Ratifications of ILO conventions: Ratifications by Convention|website=www.ilo.org|access-date=2016-03-03}} 8–11 days of National Holidays (often moved to a next working day if overlap with Saturdays or Sundays).{{cite web|url=http://zib.com.ua/ru/118507-vihodnie_dni_-_2016_kabmin_nazval_prazdnichnie_i_vihodnie_dn.html|title=Выходные дни - 2016: Кабмин назвал праздничные и выходные дни|website=zib.com.ua}} | style="text-align:center;"|18 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|29 |- |{{flag|United Arab Emirates}} |The worker shall be entitled during every year of service an annual leave of no less than the following periods: Two days for each month should the period of service of the worker be of six months at least and a year at most; Thirty days for each year should the period of service of the worker exceed one year. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in the United Arab Emirates|10 paid public holidays]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thenational.ae/business/personal-finance/how-much-annual-leave-are-uae-domestic-staff-entitled-to|title=How much annual leave are UAE domestic staff entitled to?|website=The National|access-date=2016-03-25}} | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|32 |- |{{flag|United Kingdom}} |Employees are entitled to 28 total working days (5.6 weeks) of annual leave. These often include the [[Public holidays in the United Kingdom|8 public/bank holidays]] which otherwise would be unpaid. Many employers will offer 25 days of paid annual leave in addition to the 8 recognised bank holidays. Paid time off can increase with years of service. For example, an employee might accrue one extra day for every 5 years of service up to a maximum of 30 days paid leave, exclusive of bank holidays. Some employers will allow staff to purchase or sell holiday, usually a maximum of 5 days. Part-time workers are entitled to the same amount of leave but this is calculated on a pro-rata basis.{{cite web|title=Holiday entitlement|url=https://www.gov.uk/holiday-entitlement-rights/entitlement|website=Gov.UK|publisher=United Kingdom Government|accessdate=15 October 2014}}[https://web.archive.org/web/20161029045044/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/europe/uk-english.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|8 | style="text-align:center;"|28 |- |{{flag|United States}} |There is no federal or state statutory minimum paid vacation or paid public holidays. Paid leave is at the discretion of the employers to its employees.{{cite web|url=http://www.dol.gov/dol/topic/workhours/vacation_leave.htm|title=Vacation Leave|date=9 December 2015|publisher=}}[https://web.archive.org/web/20161029044942/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/northamerica/usa-english.pdf] According to the [[Bureau of Labor Statistics|US Bureau of Labor Statistics]], 77% of private employers offer paid vacation to their employees; full-time employees earn on average 10 vacation days after one year of service.{{cite web|title = Paid leave in private industry over the past 20 years : Beyond the Numbers: U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics|url = http://www.bls.gov/opub/btn/volume-2/paid-leave-in-private-industry-over-the-past-20-years.htm|website = www.bls.gov|access-date = 2016-02-08|first = Robert W. Van|last = Giezen}} Similarly, 77% of private employers give their employees paid time off during public holidays, on average 8 holidays per year.{{cite web |title= 2015 Holiday Schedules |work= Society for Human Resource Management |accessdate= December 24, 2014 |date= November 10, 2014 |quote= A majority of employers (94-97%) plan to observe New Year's Day, Memorial Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving and Christmas in 2015. Because Independence Day falls on a Saturday, 60% of organizations will be closed on Friday, July 3, the day before Independence Day. |url= http://shrm.org/research/surveyfindings/articles/pages/SHRM-2015-Holiday-Schedules.aspx }} Some employers offer no vacation at all.{{cite web |title = 2014 Employee Benefits: An Overview of Employee Benefits Offerings in the U.S.|work = Society for Human Resource Management|first1 = Christina|last1 = Lee|first2 = Alexander|last2 = Alonso|first3 = Evren|last3 = Esen|first4 = Jennifer|last4 = Schramm|first5 = Yan|last5 = Dong|date = June 2014|pages = 28–32|url = http://shrm.org/Research/SurveyFindings/Documents/14-0301%20Benefits_Report_TEXT_FNL.pdf|accessdate = December 24, 2014}} The average number of paid vacation days offered by private employers is 10 days after 1 year of service, 14 days after 5 years, 17 days after 10 years, and 20 days after 20 years.{{cite web|url=http://www.bls.gov/ncs/ebs/benefits/2011/ownership/private/table23a.htm|title=Paid vacations: Number of days by service requirement|publisher=}} | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"|0 |- |{{flag|Uruguay}} |All workers, in the private sector and civil servants, are entitled to at least 20 days of paid annual leave. Workers who have worked in the same company, are entitled to an additional day of leave for every four years of seniority. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Uruguay|5 paid public holidays]].Ministerio de Trabajo y Seguridad Social (Uruguay) - Régimen de Licencia [https://web.archive.org/web/20090320002136/http://www.mtss.gub.uy/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=1595&Itemid=1595] | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|5 | style="text-align:center;"|25 |- |{{flag|Uzbekistan}} | | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Vanuatu}} |Every employer shall grant to an employee who has been in continuous employment with the same employer for: (a) a period of 1 to 6 years - annual leave on full pay at the rate of 1.25 working days per month for each year of employment; or (b) a period of 7 to 19 years - annual leave on full pay at the rate of 1.75 working days per month for each year of employment. There are no legal provisions for pay on [[Public holidays in Vanuatu|public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160406163815/http://vcci.com.vu/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/3.4-factsheet-sundays-and-public-holidays.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|0 | style="text-align:center;"|15 |- |{{flag|Venezuela}} |Workers are entitled to enjoy 15 days of paid annual leave in the first year plus one day for each year of service with the same employer up to a maximum of 15 extra days. | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"| | style="text-align:center;"| |- |{{flag|Vietnam}} | Employees working in normal working conditions are entitled to 12 working days after every 12 months of employment. This entitlement increases by one additional day of leave for every five years of employment in an enterprise or with an employer. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Vietnam|10 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20161029045327/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/asia/vietnam-english.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|12 | style="text-align:center;"|10 | style="text-align:center;"|22 |- |{{flag|Yemen}} |Workers shall be entitled to leave of not less than 30 days with full pay for each year of effective service, to be calculated on the basis of at least two-and-a- half days for each month. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Yemen|15 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160302111202/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/gulf-middle-east/Decentworkcheck-Yemen-English.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|15 | style="text-align:center;"|37 |- |{{flag|Zambia}} |Employees are entitled to two days of paid holidays in respect of each period of one month's service. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Zimbabwe|11 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20161028153110/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/zambia-english.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|20 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|31 |- |{{flag|Zimbabwe}} |An employee is entitled to one twelfth of the employee's qualifying service in each year of employment, subject to a maximum accrual of ninety days of paid vacation leave. Employees are also entitled to [[Public holidays in Zimbabwe|11 paid public holidays]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20161028153245/http://www.wageindicator.org/documents/decentworkcheck/africa/zimbabwe-english.pdf] | style="text-align:center;"|22 | style="text-align:center;"|11 | style="text-align:center;"|33 |} ==See also== *[[Annual leave]] *[[Parental leave]] *[[List of holidays by country]] ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[http://www.businessinsider.com/what-its-like-to-have-nationally-mandated-work-vacation-2017-10/ 6 people from around the world share what it's like to have nationally mandated work vacation]. ''Business Insider''. October 16, 2017 [[Category:Labour law|*]] [[Category:Lists by country|Statutory minimum employment leave]] [[Category:Leave|Annual leave by country]] [[Category:Society-related lists|Annual leave by country]]

page.title: List of mountains and hills of the Eifel

revision.text:
This '''List of mountains and hills in the Eifel''' contains a selection of [[mountains]] (2000 feet or higherThere is no universally agreed definition of a mountain, but Whittow (1984) suggests 2,000 feet or ~600 metres as common) and hills (below 2000 feet) in the low mountain range of the [[Eifel]] which lies mainly in [[Germany]] but also crosses into [[Belgium]]. The Eifel is located predominantly in the German states of [[Rhineland-Palatinate]] and [[North Rhine-Westphalia]] and belongs to the [[Rhenish Massif]]. :''See also:'' [[List of mountains and hills in North Rhine-Westphalia]] and [[List of mountains and hills in Rhineland-Palatinate]] {|class="wikitable sortable" | style="background: #FFEBAD" width="20%"| '''Elevation''' | style="background: #FFEBAD" width="7%"| '''Height '''
(m) | style="background: #FFEBAD" width="17%"| '''Eifel region(s)''' | style="background: #FFEBAD" width="18%"| '''District'''/
'''Province''' | style="background: #FFEBAD" width="28%" class="unsortable"| '''Remarks''' | style="background: #FFEBAD" width="10%" class="unsortable"| '''Image''' |- | [[Hohe Acht]] | 746.9 | [[High Eifel]] | [[Landkreis Ahrweiler|Ahrweiler]],
[[Landkreis Mayen-Koblenz|Mayen-Koblenz]] | Highest elevation in the
Eifel and the High Eifel;
Type: [[volcano]];
site of the ''Kaiser Wilhelm Tower'' | [[File:HoheachtRassberg.jpg|left|140px]] |- | [[Ernstberg]]
(also: Erresberg) | 698.8 | Vulkan Eifel | [[Landkreis Vulkaneifel|Vulkaneifel]] | Highest of the west Eifel volcanos;
second highest mountain in the Eifel;
Type: [[volcano]] | [[File:Erresberg.jpg|left|140px]] |- | unnamed peak?
([[Schwarzer Mann]]) | 699.1 | Vulkan Eifel | [[Landkreis Vulkaneifel|Vulkaneifel]] | Highest of the west Eifel volcanos;
second highest mountain in the Eifel;
Type: [[volcano]] | [[File:Erresberg.jpg|left|140px]] |- | [[Schwarzer Mann]] | 697.8 | [[Schnee Eifel]],
[[Schneifel]] | [[Eifelkreis Bitburg-Prüm]] | Highest point of the Schneifel ridge
and hence the Schnee Eifel | [[File:Schwarzermann Schneifel.jpg|left|140px]] |- | [[Signal de Botrange]] | 694.24 | [[Hohes Venn]] | [[Liège (province)|Liège]] ([[Belgium|B]]) | Highest mountain in Belgium and the Hohes Venn | [[File:1031350 Botrange Baltia.jpg|left|140px]] |- | [[Weißer Stein (Eifel)|Weißer Stein]] | 693 | [[North Eifel]],
[[Zitter Forest]] | [[Kreis Euskirchen|Euskirchen]] | Highest mountain of the Zitter Forest and in North Rhine-Westphalia west of the Rhine; second highest mountain in Belgium; site of observation tower on the (German) eastern slopes of the mountain |[[File:Aussichtsturm Weißer Stein nahe Hellenthal, Eifel-0017.jpg|left|140x140px]] |- | [[Scharteberg]] | 691.4 | Vulkan Eifel | [[Landkreis Vulkaneifel|Vulkaneifel]] | Second highest elevation in the Vulkan Eifel,
lies between Ernstberg and Nerother Kopf;
site of transmission tower of [[Südwestrundfunk|SWR]]’s [[Eifel Transmitter]] | [[File:Scharteberg.jpg|left|140px]] |- | Burgberg ("castle mountain")
of the [[Nürburg (castle)|Nürburg]] | 676.5 | [[High Eifel]] | [[Landkreis Ahrweiler|Ahrweiler]] | Second highest elevation in the High Eifel;
Type: [[volcano]];
Located inside the [[Nordschleife]] of the old [[Nürburgring]]; site of [[Nürburg (Burg)|Nürburg]] castle | [[File:Nuerburg2.jpg|left|140px]] |- | [[Hochkelberg]] | 674.9 | [[High Eifel]] | [[Landkreis Vulkaneifel|Vulkaneifel]] | Third highest elevation in the High Eifel;
Type: [[stratovolcano]];

page.title: List of places named after Franjo Tuđman

revision.text:
[[File:Spomenik Franji Tuđmanu.JPG|thumb|mini|Monument on [[Knin Fortress]]]] [[File:Dr. Franjo Tuđman, Pridraga - jugoistok.jpg|thumb|150px|Statue in [[Pridraga]]]] This is a partial '''list of places named in honor of [[Franjo Tuđman]]''', the 1st [[President of Croatia|President]] of the independent Republic of [[Croatia]] from 1990 until 1999: {{Expand list|date=August 2008}}
==Airports== [[Zagreb Airport|Franjo Tuđman Airport]], [[Zagreb]]
==Bridges== *[[Franjo Tuđman Bridge (Čapljina)|Franjo Tuđman Bridge]], [[Čapljina]][[File:Most Franje Tuđmana-Čapljina04332.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Bridge in Čapljina]] *[[Franjo Tuđman Bridge (Dubrovnik)|Franjo Tuđman Bridge]], [[Dubrovnik]][[File:Dubrovnik-F.Tudjman-Bridge-the.gate.jpg|thumb|right|200px|bridge in Dubrovnik]] *[[Franjo Tuđman Bridge (Osijek)|Franjo Tuđman Bridge]], [[Osijek]]

Created new 'See also' section. Added link to timeline of women in science.
revision.text:
{{Infobox scientist | name = Isobel Moira Dunbar | honorific_suffix = [[Fellow of the Royal Society of Canada|FRSC]] [[Order of Canada|OC]] | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Isobel Moira Dunbar | birth_date = {{Birth date|1918|2|3|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Edinburgh]], [[Scotland]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1999|11|22|1918|2|3|df=yes}} | death_place = | nationality = [[United Kingdom|Scottish]] | other_names = | education = Cranley School for Girls | alma_mater = [[St Anne's College, Oxford|St Anne's College]], Oxford | known_for = ''Arctic Canada from the Air'' | awards = [[Massey Medal]]
[[Meteorological Service of Canada]] Centennial Award | notable_works = }} '''Isobel Moira Dunbar''' {{post-nominals|FRSC|OC}} (3 February 1918 – 22 November 1999) was a Scottish-Canadian [[glaciologist]] and [[Arctic]] ice researcher. ==Early life== Moira Dunbar was born in 1918 in [[Edinburgh, Scotland]]. She grew up in [[Stornoway]], [[Strathpeffer]], and [[Kilmarnock]], and attended Cranley School for Girls.{{cite news|url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/news/12202896.display/|title=Moira Dunbar|date=11 December 1999|work=[[The Herald (Glasgow)|The Herald]]|accessdate=1 November 2015}} Dunbar studied [[geography]] at [[St Anne's College, Oxford|St Anne's College]] of the [[University of Oxford]], completing her Bachelor of Arts in 1939.{{cite journal|url=http://www.igsoc.org/awards/honorary/j10j211.pdf|title=Women in glaciology, a historical perspective|journal=Journal of Glaciology|volume=56|issue=200|year=2010|first1=Christina L. |last1=Hulbe|first2=Weili|last2=Wang|first3=Simon |last3=Ommanney|pages=944–964|bibcode=2010JGlac..56..944H|doi=10.3189/002214311796406202}} During World War II, she travelled around the [[United Kingdom]] with a theatre troupe as an actor and stage manager. ==Career== Dunbar emigrated to [[Canada]] in 1947 and found work with the Joint Intelligence Bureau, where she studied Arctic ice movement. In 1952 she joined the [[Defence Research Board]] in the position of Scientific Staff Officer in the Arctic Research Section.{{cite web|url=http://www.science.ca/scientists/scientistprofile.php?pID=346|title=Moira Isobel Dunbar|date=22 June 2015|website=Science.ca|accessdate=1 November 2015}} She specialised in [[sea ice]] and navigation through frozen Arctic waters. In 1954, she applied to join the crew of scientists on a [[Royal Canadian Navy]] [[icebreaker]] travelling to the Arctic, but her request was denied as women could not be posted on naval vessels. She continued making requests until she was given permission to join an icebreaker with the [[Transport Canada|Department of Transport]] in 1955. She thus became the first woman to conduct scientific research from Canadian icebreakers.{{cite web|url=http://www.rcgs.org/about/history/northern_exposure.asp|title= Northern exposure |first=Mary|last=Vincent|publisher=[[Royal Canadian Geographical Society]]|accessdate=1 November 2015}} She served on numerous icebreakers and spent 560 hours on [[Royal Canadian Air Force]] aircraft, studying ice formations in the High Arctic. She was among the first women to fly over the [[North Pole]]. Dunbar published numerous papers on Arctic sea ice, and in 1956 she co-authored ''Arctic Canada from the Air'' with Keith Greenaway, a navigator with the [[Royal Canadian Air Force]]. Dunbar and Greenway's book was an early work in the field of observing sea ice through airborne photography. In her other papers, Dunbar studied the use of radar remote sensing in sea-ice research, promoted the standardisation of sea-ice terminology, and wrote historical accounts of [[Arctic exploration]]. She investigated icebreaking methods in the [[Soviet Union]] and [[Finland]] in 1964, and was an adviser to Arctic [[hovercraft]] trials in 1966–1969.{{cite web|url=http://www.thecanadianencyclopedia.ca/en/article/isobel-moira-dunbar/|title=Isobel Moira Dunbar|work=[[The Canadian Encyclopedia]]|first=Diana|last=Rowley|date=10 June 2008|accessdate=1 November 2015}} In 1971, Dunbar won the [[Meteorological Service of Canada|Meteorological Service of Canada's]] Centennial Award. In 1972 she was awarded the [[Royal Canadian Geographical Society|Royal Canadian Geographical Society's]] [[Massey Medal]] for "her excellent work in arctic geography and sea ice";{{cite web|url=http://www.rcgs.org/awards/massey_medal/previous_winners.asp|title=Massey Medal|publisher=[[Royal Canadian Geographical Society]]|accessdate=1 November 2015}} she is the only woman to have won the medal. She was a Fellow of the [[Royal Society of Canada]] and was made an [[Officer of the Order of Canada]] in 1977. She also served as governor of the [[Arctic Institute of North America]] and director of the [[Royal Canadian Geographical Society]]. Dunbar retired in 1978 and died on 22 November 1999, at the age of 81. ==See also== * [[Timeline of women in science]] ==References== {{reflist|30em}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dunbar, Moira}} [[Category:1918 births]] [[Category:1999 deaths]] [[Category:Glaciologists]] [[Category:Canadian geologists]] [[Category:Canadian women geologists]] [[Category:Canadian women scientists]] [[Category:Scottish women scientists]] [[Category:Scottish geologists]] [[Category:Scottish women geologists]] [[Category:20th-century geographers]] [[Category:Canadian geographers]] [[Category:Alumni of St Anne's College, Oxford]] [[Category:Scottish emigrants to Canada]] [[Category:Fellows of the Royal Society of Canada]] [[Category:Officers of the Order of Canada]] [[Category:20th-century women scientists]] [[Category:Massey Medal recipients]] [[Category:Scottish geographers]]
